Reviews.Title: “Very nice room with terrace and location”
Reviews.Author: chungpeiming
Reviews.Content: We had honeymoon in Rome and 1st stop is here. Three of those days we stayed at The Hotel Mozart, at the Suite #410 which with nice room, location, and service. Our flight arrived in early morning and hotel provided us early check-in around 11AM which is very wonderful for us to took a shower and continue the tour in Roma of 1st day. Other than that is great room with nice terrace, I love that very much. If friends will be Rome for personal trip, I will recommend this hotel for them.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but great”
Reviews.Author: Anelan
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome earlier this week. Was our first time and we choose this hotel from Booking.com. Luckily he location was excellent. Walking distance from the center, next to the Famous Spanish Steps. The service was excellent, and the staff very helpfull and kind. Very good standarts of clenliness. The room was a bit small though we were using it only at night. Breakfast buffet had everything and the quality was exeptional. We would like to thank all the staff there for adding to our great holidays in Rome TIPS Only negative was the poor WIFI reception

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied Aussies”
Reviews.Author: Kevinontheroad
Reviews.Content: Location is very convenient. Room was quite large, clean, comfortable and quiet. We just loved the beauitiful violin, piano and singing drifting into our room from the nearby music school. My wife and I were very satisfied with all aspects of Hotel Mozart including the courteous way the staff dealt with our needs. They were committed to solving some issues with WiFi. After our stay we especially appreciated the quick and efficient way Antonio located some lost property and arranged to send back to Australia. Thanks! We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free cappuccino & a fabulous stay.”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveller095
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. 2nd fabulous stay. Hotel is just off via del corso, near Piazza del Popolo. Great location. Lots of restaurants and shopping right there. 5 minute walk to Spanish Steps and Metro Station. 15 minute walk to Piazza Navona, Patheon, Trevi Fountain. We walked to Colessum/Ancient Rome, Vatican, Campo dei Fiori, but you need really good walking shoes; bus or taxi may make more sense for many particularly as there is still lots of walking to do once you get to the attraction. Excellent hotel staff service and comfy rooms. Continental breakfast included. Tip - free cappuccino at breakfast if you ask for it. This is a 3-1/2* hotel, but it has character, great location, great staff and a fabulous rooftop terrace. We actually loved it better than the 4-1/2* hotel we next stayed at in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Rome for a weekend to celebrate grandmothers 70th birthaday!”
Reviews.Author: Skogro
Reviews.Content: Family from Norway, all ages, spending a weekend at the hotel and Vivaldi Suits. Especially pleased with the suites, a short walk from the hotel, and with the feeling of real Italian charm. Ideally located within walking distance to ancient Rome. Hotel had a very nice top terasse. We will definitly consider this place again when visitng Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay off the corso”
Reviews.Author: Moncala22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Vittoria suites a little ways from the main hotel. The apartment felt like you were living in Rome. There is a music school right across which was awesome to hear when we had the windows opened. And if you closed the windows you couldn't hear a thing !!!!! We will definitely return and stay at the Mozart hotel when we come back to Roma!!

Reviews.Title: “In my opinion not worthy of a 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: DroghedaAnnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a 3 night break at this hotel equivalent in my opinion to an Irish 2 star hotel. The room was very clean and very small as was the double bed. The bathroom has to be the smallest I ever had. Needed to turn sideways to make your way to the shower and we are by no means big people. Walls are paper thin and could hear everything that was going on next door! Staff were lovely and very helpful. Breakfast room was nice and bright. Food in plentiful supply although not a great choice. ok value for money

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: don5432
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Vivaldi Suites which is part of Hotel Mozart. We were in Rome a year ago and so enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Mozart that we returned to it again this past February. Everything about it was excellent: the staff, the accommodations, the breakfast, location etc. If we return to Rome next year I imagine we'll stay there a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the centro storico”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeFergal
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and stayed in one of the Vivaldi suites, off Via del Corso. Room was fine, with a large bedroom, excellent bathroom with shower, bath and jacuzzi, and a large anteroom with a wardrobe and shoe-rack. The mattresses were excellent and the room was well back from the street,so quiet, ensuring an excellent night's sleep. Breakfast was above average for Roman hotels. The location simply can't be bettered - within walking distance of most of the major sights, and right in the middle of the shopping district. There are some decent places to eat on Via della Croce (Enoteca Antica, Otello della Concordia), one of the best ice-cream parlours in Rome was a 10 minute walk away (Giolitti's) and, if you need public transport, the metro and bus routes are easily accessible. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Californiaforever
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish stairs. Very good shopping just around the corner and a 20 min walk to Pantheon, Piazza Nevona, Colosseum, Castel di Angelo and much more.

Reviews.Title: “great location but don't stay facing Via del Corso”
Reviews.Author: Hertshopeful
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have said, this hotel is in an excellent location and is extremely convenient for all sites, shopping and good restaurants/bars. It does however have a major problem in that the rooms are not well noise insulated, We were in a room facing Via del Corso which was very noisy (nightly rubbish collection, groups of loud people etc) but we also had the misfortune to be located next door to the most inconsiderate couple who started their day around 7.30am with a huge row which went on for at least 2 hours despite my husband banging on the wall and me complaining to reception. They also chain smoked i their room and the smell came in to our room and the corridor via the air con - after 4 nights we were glad to come home. I am sure that this however does not happen all the time - but if we ever return to this hotel I would be quicker to ask for another room. The breakfast was chaotic between 9.30 and 10.15 - possibly due to the lack of anyone taking charge. The variety of cold food was adequate but since a lot of the guests were English, it may have been nice to have some hot food supplied as well, Having said that - it could make for more complaints as they didn't seem to be able to cope with what they are currently offering. There is a pleasant bar on the first floor which has a couple of computers for the guests to use, This is very useful as we could print off our boarding cards and check in on line etc, The downside of this first floor bar is that it is very close to the first floor bedrooms and I am sure that if they have the same insulation as we did, then they didn't get to sleep early each evening, We asked the hotel about a taxi to the airport and was told they had a special deal with a taxi company and would arrange one for 48euros, Since we only paid 40euros to get to the hotel we walked up to the Spanish Steps (3 mins) and got one from the taxi rank at 40euros

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!!”
Reviews.Author: pallinime
Reviews.Content: + A GREAT location in the heart of the city! Comfortable room with facilities for making tea/coffee. Breakfast is good, but there's no hot dishes (sausages, scrambled eggs, etc.) - Unhelpful and unfriendly staff Rather cold in the room

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Mon59
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a great location just off the Via dei Corso (many shops) and close to the infamous Via Condotti and the Spanish Steps. Stayed in a triple room (416) which was very comfortable. It had 2 twin beds and a single sofa sleeper. The bathroom was roomy and had a bath tub and a shower (small). They also provide coffee making facilities in the room and there was a flat screen tv. It is not cheap but breakfast and wifi were included in the rate. There is a lounge on the 1st floor where you can have drinks and in the corner is a computer station for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful. The Hotel was in a great location, very central for all the wonderful tourist attractions. My room was very comfortable, nicely decorated, clean and had a spacious shower room. The breakfast buffet was really good - lots of variety in its menu. Wifi was a bit unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: After spending a couple of nights in Radisson it was like a breath of fresh air (really, we couldn't even open the window in R). If you like ultra-modern hi-tech places don't read any further. If you prefer traditional buildings and original features - you'll love hotel Mozart. The location is excellent, just around the corner from the Spanish Steps, quiet pedestrian street and easy access to city centre and public transport. Room was large, with a window opening into a pretty courtyard and a jacuzzi shower, which was an utter bliss after a hard day exploring the ruins. Staff was friendly and helpful, even printed maps for us, when needed. Just one thing though: don't take their advice on where to dine - we did and it was awful touristy place with poor quality food, and very overpriced. Apart from that - one of the best hotels we've stayed at, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Krista G
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my husband and I stayed at Hotel Mozart and we would stay there again. Great location and the breakfast was fantastic - homemade cookies and cakes. The decor of the rooms was very chic and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LittleCurrant
Reviews.Content: Our room was big enough, but the hotel was very noisy (tile floors meant lots of echoing when doors slam etc). The hotel has elevators, but to get to the rooms there are lots of corridoors with little steps up and down. The bathroom was tiny (one had to jump over the toilet to reach the shower as there wasn't enough room to pass beside it). The shower had no water pressure and an ineffective shower curtain. Location is not fantastic, it's close to the Spanish steps but not much else. Breakfast was average. Staff were not helpful when we asked for help with sites etc. There are free computers available in the lounge. For the price of the rooms we were very dissapointed and won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pure delight!”
Reviews.Author: NelsonFamily2011
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Mozart - it is a beautiful little hotel in a great location near the Spanish Steps - very convenient to all the major attractions yet tucked away and quiet. Our room was charming and very comfortable with all the amenities you would expect along with friendly, courteous service. They served breakfast daily with many excellent choices for every traveler's taste. This was a wonderful hotel to start our tour of Italy in. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “definatley be going back”
Reviews.Author: betDublin
Reviews.Content: we stayed here last weekend. We stayed in the Vivaldi suites which were in a courtyard just round the corner from the hotel The check in was efficent. The room was fantastic; very spacious & clean. The bathroom products were fab! breakfast was in a lovely room upstairs & was sufficent. I am not into huge buffets etc; so what was provided was very good. Staff overall were lovely & very courtious to us. we had a fantastic trip overall & couldnt fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: RustyS2345
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the Via dei Corso. Wonderful buffet breakfast. However my wife had to lay a bathmat in front of the toilet because the bathroom floor was sticky and obviously not cleaned as part of their daily service. Hotel staff generally very helpful however the evening front desk manager was less than patient and courteous....told us that many of the restaurants were closed on Sunday evening because he was too lazy to offer a convenient recommendation. Two computers available however one inoperable and the other slow.

Reviews.Title: “more than expected”
Reviews.Author: Arans2011
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. The room, "superior double room" was very comfortable and relatively large. Breakfast was very nice with varieties you may choose from. The Wifi was slow. We have been to Rome for many times and this hotel was the best we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: mimi3107
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart is an excellent location near Via di Corsa, ideal for walking, sightseeing and shopping. Breakfast is very nice with great choice of muesli, bakery, pies, milk, yogurt, cheese, ham, juice drinks,tea, coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mozart, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mags39_11
Reviews.Content: Our Travel Agent, Justin from Italian Tourism US, recommended this hotel for our three day stay in Rome prior to embarking on a Mediterranean cruise. It is not well known by travel agents who aren't familiar with Italy. The hotel has extremely nice accommodations, very nice, helpful personnel, and a mouth-watering (free) breakfast. It is centrally located - not far from the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, Piazza del Popolo and midway between the Colosseum and the Vatican City. The gentleman at reception told us the #117 bus, which runs round trip, makes the trip to the Colosseum very easy to reach and the Metro station by the Spanish Steps (Metro Spagna) will take you to Vatican City. If I were to return to Rome. I would definitely make reservations at the Hotel Mozart, Via del Greci.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine189908
Reviews.Content: We, a family with two children (aged 5 and 7), stayed at the Vittoria Suite of Hotel Mozart for 5 days. The service at the hotel was excellent, friendly and polite with style. The Vittoria Suite is situated just 100 metres from the main hotel, by Via Vittoria, a tiny street with some nice shops. Being on the first floor, we did not get direct sunshine in, and the apartment was a bit dark, but keeping the curtains off it was ok. The apartment was just enough for 2 adults and 2 children. The kitchenette was small but workable, with dishwasher (take your own tablets with you), a refrigerator and a microwave, but we didn´t dare to use the gas oven as we are used to an electric one. There was no brush for washing the dishes, but we didn´t need one. There was a laptop with some restrictions in where it let you go (some pdfs weren´t allowed, such as a pdf of Roman tram routes), and a cell phone to use when you needed to contact the main hotel. There were 2 LCD TVs, one in the bedroom and one in the livingroom, and the latter one had a SKY connection, so there were plenty to watch in case of a rainy day (TV heaven for our children who didn´t mind that almost everything had been dubbed into Italian). The beds were OK to sleep, but the bed in the bedroom was a bit short for us (187 cm and 178 cm). The bathroom was very nice, but there was a tiny smell of mould there. But it had a fan to take the moisture off and an electric drying line on the wall. Being October, the floors were coldish, but we had slippers. The slippers were wery much needed, as the FLOORS were also DIRTY and DUSTY, which was odd as otherwise everything was so clean in the apartment (except for some cupboards in the bedroom which we didn´t need anyway) and in the main hotel. The towels were changed every day, and the dustbins were emptied. The location of the hotel and the aparment was excellent, with just 100 metres to the Spanish steps and the metro station there. Across the narrow street of Vittoria there was a music school, so at times you were able to listen to some excellent classical music played or sung. 50 metres down the Vittoria street there was a tiny Carrefour supermarket and everywhere there were bars, restaurants, pizzerias... Despite the central location it was very peaceful at night, not a sound outside until morning when the maintenance people started their work. The breakfast was great, every day the same, but with a lot of variety so you didn´t get bored. The ladies were so friendly there. Upon request it was possible to get a cup of cappuccino or some other special coffee. The service at the hotel desk was also very nice, they would do your bookings for you (to museums for example). We couldn´t get a detailed receipt for our hotel bill, though. Easy to recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “vivaldi appartments”
Reviews.Author: rebecca r
Reviews.Content: Booked four nights at the Mozart, which was at the top of my price range, when we arrived we were very happy to be upgraded to the Vivaldi, which was a few doors away and very easy to get to. It was a lovely clean room with large bathroom with a proper jacuzzi bath and large shower, the room was very quiet and relaxing after the hustle and bustle of the city and we were lucky enough to have windows that opened onto a classical music acadamy, so it was a little like going to heaven. Facilities, location and breakfast were all recomendable

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacques-SYD
Reviews.Content: The hotel Mozart in Rome is just minutes away from the Spanish steps. A very welcoming staff and highly knowledgeable of the area. The rooms are comfortable and clean... and if you want to spend the extra, I strongly suggest the Deluxe rooms as they have wonderful balconies with exceptional traditional views. The brekkie is superb with sweet and savoury selections, coffee, tea and even boiled eggs for those of us who like our protein in the morning. I look forward to staying there on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “4th Visit!”
Reviews.Author: tabbykins
Reviews.Content: We've stayed once within the hotel itself & this our 3rd stay in the Vittoria Apartment, one block down the Corso from the hotel. Both are great but we much prefer the apartment which is spacious with bedroom, bathroom, very good size lounge/dining room, small kitchen (only used by us so store Prosecco & beer in fridge & making teas.) Since our visit last year the a brand new very chic bathroom has been installed. Whilst we were there Rome was in the midst of a heatwave & the Aircon in the apartment was more than adequate & kept the whole apartment nicely cooled at all times. Breakfast in the hotel (included) was as good as always & as I had my arm in a sling the ladies were so kind insisting on helping me with things from the buffet. Location is as perfect as you will find in Rome & as many have said, the roof terrace garden, on 2 levels, with its lounging chairs & upper bar with tables, chairs & umbrellas is a divine spot at any time of day or night. Prices at the bar are surprisingly reasonable, less than surrounding bars. Staff are professional & helpful, many have been there for a long time, always nice to see familiar faces every visit. The price of the apartment is in my view excellent value. I would never stay anywhere else in Rome & staying in the apartment makes me feel like I live there. Thank you management & staff of Mozart for looking after us so week every time we visit you. We'll be bcak, of course!

Reviews.Title: “top of the line”
Reviews.Author: liz g
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for service,location,excellent breakfast,cleaniness..here is the place.Did I mention rooftop restaurant and home made cakes and tarts by Rosella?? This is the place to stay without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: flanntronix
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the final stay in our honeymoon trip to Italy and was a fantastic base for exploring the array of sights in Rome. It is very close to the Spanish steps and Piazzo la Popolo. Our room was very clean and comfortable and had the added benefit of a private roof terrace overlooking the Roman skyline and Borghese. It was amazing to have our own space to sit and relax in the evening. Breakfast was good and catered for gluten/lactose intolerance. The staff were friendly and helpful. Although there was a lot of noise from Via Corso on our first night, the double glazed door and window meant that we were not disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Can stay here with confidence...”
Reviews.Author: gmgilchrist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean with good aircon and quiet elevators. In Italian hotels the elevator situation can be very bad. It's OK here. The breakfast is comprehensive with superior quality cold meats. Boiled egg lovers will be happy. I've stayed in a few areas in Rome and I think Spanish Steps area is the best. Via Veneto is a bit of a walk and lacks life. Campo di Fiore is a bit scruffy. I have not dared to stay in the Terminus area.

Reviews.Title: “"Location...Location..Location"”
Reviews.Author: Bantamlad
Reviews.Content: Having spent the weekend in Bracciano for a family wedding my wife and I decided to have have a few days in the City to chill after the hectic weekend. My wife has stayed here before and was very complementary of the Hotel, so it seemed the natural choice. The location is in my opinion perfect if you want to explore the city and visit the main places of interest as they are pretty much within walking distance if you are reasonably fit. We visited all the obvious.. Colosseo,Piazza Di Spagna, Il Foro, Basilica Di San Pietro, Pantheon, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Navona,as well as Basilica Di San Giovanni..Amazing!, Basilica Di San Clemente ( A Church built on top of another Church dating back 2000 years!) Bocca del la Verita' ( mouth of Truth) and the star in my opinion.. Galleria Borghese! Do not leave Rome without visiting this amazing collection of sculptures from Bernini and paintings from Carravaggio, Raffalele and Titian ( Booking must be made B4). All these places can be visited within walking distance. The Mozart may not be the cheapest Hotel in Rome but what you save in Taxi fares ( and they do add up!!) makes up for it. The Hotel is spotless with large comfortable rooms and a gorgeous Terrazza where you can relax and enjoy pre dinner cocktails and enjoy the sun setting over the Rome skyline. One negative and only one, avoid a room facing onto Via Corso it gets very noisy and can continue until the early hours.

Reviews.Title: “If you want the illusion of an authentic Rome lifestyle - this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: Red_Three
Reviews.Content: As a birthday gift my girlfriend booked one of the elite apartments which is part of the Hotel Mozart. These are deluxe rooms in a self contained apartment block which is located 1 street away from the hotel itself. The location is fantastic- we ended up walking everywhere (parthenon, trevi fountain, spanish steps etc...) as it seemed much easier than taking public transport. Right outside you have a huge array of shops + restaurants. The rooms were very well decorated, comfy beds, jacuzzi bath tub, flatscreen tv. The ONLY slight downside was that our beautiful window + shutters opened out facing a wall, also the wifi connection was very erratic. But these are small issues. I would have to say the best thing about these rooms was the fact that you feel you have your own apartment in the city, the rest of the building is made up of apartments and you share a gorgeous communal entrance which opens onto the high street. Access is through a variety of key codes + swipe cards. I would very happily stay here again and have no problem recommending it to a friend. Obviously this comes at a price and i'd be hard pressed to say it was a super bargain. But for this level of comfort - i'd have to say it was well priced. Definitely recommended for couples and romantic getaways!

Reviews.Title: “Elite Apartment Gave Feeling of Living in Rome with hotel amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jerusalembarbara
Reviews.Content: The Mozart's location is superb, and the staff helpful and friendly. For folks like us who have dietary requirements and like home catering, having the small but well-appointed kitchen is a huge plus. I was missing garlic, and actually borrowed some from the woman upstairs, giving me a feeling of "living in Rome" that is missing from the usual tourist experience. At the same time, there's hotel service, and excellent coffee at the hotel's elegant breakfast room. A laptop with high-speed internet, is an unusual touch in my travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at Mozart again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: bridget c
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel off the internet and could not have made a better choice. Location, cleaniness of the room/hotel, staff, breakfast choice and presentation were all more than I had hoped for. The elevator, free internet, air conditioning were all in working order. Will stay at the Mozart hotel again and not hesitate to recommend to anyone....

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to be number one!”
Reviews.Author: Annie C
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, everything was perfect! Fabulous breakfast, bedroom, bathroom and location. Staff always smiling. Would definitely stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel location and hotel services. Highly recommended 4 couples who intend to visit Rome for 2-3 days”
Reviews.Author: Chirumalla
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very neat and the people are very friendly. The hotel located at one of the best streets in Rome. All must and see tourist spots are close by from the hotel, like Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza del Popolo, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, etc. Very good place for shopping. Easy accessible to Bus and Metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well decorated rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: emimurata
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the first week of August (not recommended if you struggle in the heat!!) and had two rooms. We arrived before check-in but they said we could check in straight away if we didn't mind staying in Vivaldi Rooms which is on Via Del Corso, just around the corner from the small street Hotel Mozart is on. The rooms were a decent size for Rome, seemed to have been recently refurbished with lovely shower rooms. We had problems getting the tv to work but I think that was us and not that it wasn't working as we eventually figured it out on the second day! There should have been wifi in Vivaldi Rooms but we couldn't connect on to it and the communal laptop didn't seem to let us log on for some reason. The laptop probably would have worked if we could have been bothered enough to speak to someone about it, but we didn't really need it so it was fine. They also have two computers for use on the 1st floor in Hotel Mozart which worked fine and even has a printer to print your boarding passes! The roof top terrace was a nice touch, we did go there a few times and the lady working there was really helpful and nice. This was my third time in Rome and without a doubt the best location, right in the middle of it all, and can walk to Colosseum in about half an hour if you can take the scorching sun at this time of year. The breakfast room in Vivaldi was very cute, the decor really matched the rest of the building and good selection of fresh fruits, yogurts, breads as well as cereal and cold meats. The home made cakes and cookies were very welcome! There were some really small things that could have been better, like the wifi working and the shower seemed to drain quite slowly, but this would definitely not stop me recommending this hotel whole heartedly. oh, and book a ticket for the Vatican museum - the queues are just too long! If your budget can stretch, it's worth getting a tour guide. They can tell you about Michelagenlo's secrets etched into the sistine chapel!! ;) (about €45 per person, 2 -2.5 hours)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bmbooth
Reviews.Content: Our original room at Vivaldi suites was too small for 4 adults and their luggage. We asked the gentleman at the desk if they had something larger and he said it was the largest room they had. The next morning we spoke with another gentleman and he said they had an apt. available. We moved to Ripetta apt. B the next day and loved it! It is around the corner and down the block on Via Ripetta, which runs parallel to Via Corso. The apt. was upstairs in a building with private apts. It was clean, furnished well, had a large bedroom, living room, and a small kitchen with freezer, fridge, and dishwasher. We were very happy! Went to breakfast at the hotel which was very nice. The location is great for walking everywhere and there are a ton of good restaurants very near.

Reviews.Title: “A sweet boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: debsTelAviv
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night in Rome last month and stayed at the Hotel Mozart following a friend's reccommendation. It was just as she'd described - aesthetic interior, newly renovated, comfortable beds,well airconditioned rooms, excellent breakfast, polite helpful staff and very conveniently located in the historic center of Rome. We were really happy to have chosen it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location but there are some negatives with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyC70
Reviews.Content: We reserved the Hotel Mozart for one night after spending a week in Tuscany. Upon check in we were told we could have an "upgrade" at the Vivaldi apartments. We accepted the room because it was only for the one night but I feel as though they are not entirely honest when they try to sell these apartments as an upgrade. We were told the breakfast is in that building and we would have to walk over there anyway each morning which I later found out is not true. The television did not work which is not a big deal since we were barely in our room and were there for just a night but it was not repaired and they couldn't seem to figure out what was wrong. The room was also not cleaned properly, the soaps and shampoo had been used and there was some garbage in the garbage can. We loved the location and would stay in the area again as it was walking distance to most sites but we would not stay there again due to their dishonesty. The "upgrading" to the other building seemed shady to us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a calm oasis”
Reviews.Author: TwoAshes
Reviews.Content: This was a combination of business trip and leisure weekend and served both purposes well. The hotel was 2 minutes walk from our business destination on the Via del Corso and thus proved most convenient, also very well positioned to walk to many of the most popular tourist destinations, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountains, Piazza del Popolo and so on. The Metro is about 10 mins walk away at the Spanish Steps, giving easy access to all of Rome and beyond. Only issue about this location is the restaurants, primarily tourist pizza/pasta offerings unless you look hard and Rome, well - if you go anticipating you will be ripped off at some point, you might feel a bit better about it when it inevitably happens to you!

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!! And we will certainly go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: javierteresa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart is a very special place. It is safe, clean, beautiful. It is elegant and simple at the same time. It makes you feel at home. The staff is very kind and are there to help you all the time. Breakfast is a dream!!! Wonderful food and service. The desk staff is very helpful making you see the best of Rome. They are there to help and to make your stay pleasant. The rooms are comfortable and beautiful; they are spacious and have a great private terrace from which you have a special view of the city of Rome. It is by the Conservatory of Music. You hear the best music in the city, by your window. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: judyjetson
Reviews.Content: How lucky I was to have run into a colleague familiar with this hotel When she heard I was going to Rome and my then current reservation, she said cncel. You must stay at the Hotel Mozart. Everything I read confirmed her glowing reports of this perfectly located and appointed hotel, one step off the Via Corso and close to everything, I mean everything. My 4 nights were filled with delight, the service, the breakfasts, the public rooms and location. The rooms are small- yes very small, but lovely if you do not plan to spend the day in your room, and why would you-- you are in ROME!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, not cheap”
Reviews.Author: lookup76
Reviews.Content: near a variety of good restaurants and shops, this part of town teems with people.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly service”
Reviews.Author: JB_Netherlands
Reviews.Content: A pity that this hotel is marred by unfriendly service. The greeting and responses at reception were at times surly. One is suprised in a 4 star hotel, that when you report an issue with the room, after the third time it would be fixed. Sadly not the case, mde een more disappointing by the "so what" attitude of the reception whe this was mentioned again. Almost to the point of - well, you should have kept asking, so it's your own fault. The roof top bar would be great, if the staff coukd be just a little more welcoming. Disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere and Service”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraGeorge
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely older hotel on a quiet side street in an excellent location central to sites. The very attractive large public sitting room served as a much appreciated comfortable retreat in which to deal with jet lag while waiting for our room to be readied. Wireless service is included. The breakfast room is charming and breakfast excellent. The small rooftop cafe provides a beautiful view of the city and sunsets, a comfortable spot to lounge after a day of sightseeing. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Gina2400
Reviews.Content: We loved the roof top terrace, with pots full of jasmine and gardenias. The weather was great so we were able to have a prosecco on the terrace and enjoy the spectacular views. Our room was adorable and pretty quiet for being located near the Spanish Steps. The Breakfast was good - where do they get those crusty white buns? I liked the ricotta cake with cherries too. Our first night there we asked for a restaurant recommendation and were sent to Le Grotte Ristorante. It wasn't great. Apparently alot of people get sent there (we talked to other guests) but don't do it - it was average. The 2 computers for internet use weren't fast and always busy. I would stay there again though - the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “beware of hotel mozart”
Reviews.Author: fortemaine
Reviews.Content: MAY 9TH. HOTEL MOZART (VIVALDI APTS. ROME ITALY,Upon arrival to the rental apartment, we observed that it was extremely dirty in all rooms. Waste baskets were filled with debris, bathrooms were very dirty, bedsheets had blood stains on them, pillow cases had hair on them, fake eye lashes were found on pillows. Floors were also very dirty. Certainly, the apartment had not been cleaned. On the same day, shower off master bedroom would only work with scalding hot water. Also, Television was not functioning. When we initialy arrived, no one gave us a tour of the apartment nor instructions on workings of the apartment etc. We called the front desk and informed them of the problems. They answered by telling us that “ no one was available until the next day.” ON THE 10TH OF MAY ( LATER IN THE DAY) THE MANAGER CAME WITH GREAT RELUCTANCE TO VIEW THE PROBLEMS. (KEEP IN MIND THE DOWN TIME IN VISITING THE MUSEUMS AND MONUMENTS OF ROME). The cleaning was done later in the day. Also, it should be mentioned that the problem of the hot water regulater was not fixed. Hence, no showers during the duration of the 3 day stay. Security was a problem due to the opened door in the front of the building. At times it was locked, however, there were many instances when it was wide opened. MAY 11TH. THE PROBLEM WITH THE SHOWER WAS NOT RESOLVED AFTER MANY PLEAS WITH THE MANAGER. Also, the 2nd shower was a problem with the sewage backing up in. We were told that “too much water was being used” In fact, the manager also told us not to come back. “Go some place else.” MAY 12TH, DEPARTED HOTEL BY PAYING BILL AND WRITING ON RECEIPT THAT WE WERE GOING TO FILE A DISPUTE. I have traveled to Italy at least a dozen times and have never had such a problem. Particularly, the attitude and unfriendly manner of the Manager.

Reviews.Title: “All you want from a Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mainlebo
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reliable, incredible location, clean, great service, quaint, and good value the Mozart Rome is for you. From the front desk staff to the employees in the restaurant, everyone went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The room was ok size (superior) and very comfortable. Did I say great location?

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: KarenNottingham
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more expensive than we would normally go for but what a treat! The position very close to Spagna metro and the Spanish steps is very central. 30 min walk to the Vatican. It is set just inside a pretty side street. Our room overlooked a busy shopping street, great for people watching. We were not disturbed by street noise. The room was wonderful, enormous with a huge bathroom, bath and good shower. The building is beautiful, high ceilings and elegantly furnished. Lovely breakfast in a delightful room. Lovely little roof terrace. Comfortable sitting room with a bar. Another bar also open to the street was great. Prices much better than bars in nearby Piazza del Populo and the most amazing apperertivi served with the drinks. All the staff were great, friendly welcoming and very helpful. Sorry we were only staying one night on our way through Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: majorstuen
Reviews.Content: Stayed there four nights from April 3, 2011. Very comfortable hotel, nice and clean with very good service, with a quite sufficient breakfast buffet.. Perfectly situated at walking distance to a number of relevant tourist aims.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a really good situation”
Reviews.Author: jeremy21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mozart last weekend for three nights. It was really good, our room 412 was really quiet even though the hotel looks out onto the busy shopping area, anything we asked for was done really quickly, extra pillows etc, bed is 6", lovely breakfast with lots of choice.Easy to walk to from the metro if you want to catch the train from the airport. I would thoroughly recomend the Mozart.

Reviews.Title: “My new home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelClearwater
Reviews.Content: My sister, niece and I just returned from our first stay at the Hotel Mozart and it has become my new home in Rome. I have been returning to Rome every year since 1998 and have always stayed at a "5 star" hotel down the street closer to Via Condotti and decided after such terrible service during our last stay, we would try something new. My concern was mainly the room size, the view and terrace at the Mozart and everything was as promised, which was very refreshing. The room was quite large, even with 3 women with lots of luggage. The terrace was lovely and large as well and even had a large dining table with chairs out there. Breakfast had such a variety of selections to satisfy everyones taste - it was delicious. The staff was very attentive and accommodating and there wasn't anything we requested that wasn't promptly delivered. My sister broke her glasses just prior to our arrival at the hotel and can't see a thing without them. We were quickly directed to their recommended location to make sure we could get them prior to the store closing in 30 minutes. We not only got new glasses that were perfect but the store stayed open longer to make sure they could take care of us before right away. We couldn't have asked for anything more. Cesirio at the front desk was very helpful and as nice as could be. We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly and will return to the Mozart without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome. Definately would return to Hotel Mozart.”
Reviews.Author: Lobby62
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, including 2 teenagers stayed in the Vittoria Apartment for 7 nights during in December and then at the Ripette Apartment during 2011 New Year for 3 nights. The location of both apartments is fantastic. We were able to easily walk to all the major tourist attractions. The apartments were comfortable although the 4th bed is a pull-out, which might be a little small for a fourth adult. My family loved the privacy of the apartments as it made you feel like your were actually living in Rome. The hotel is very close by and the amentities of the hotel are easily available. The breakfast at the hotel was excellent and included a wide variety. We would definately return to Rome and would now stay no where else except the Mozart.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful large apartment in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: SpiderBoy
Reviews.Content: Vivaldi Suite Hotel Mozart Rome I almost don’t want to write this review and keep this apartment all to myself. We stayed in the Vivaldi Suite part of the Vivaldi Luxury Rooms. So you check in at Hotel Mozart but your apartment is 3 minutes around the corner (the porter carries your luggage) just off Via del Corso. The apartment is very large with a double bedroom, 2 bathrooms, kitchenette, lounge room and a master bedroom (large enough for a sofa and king sized bed). Oh you also get an outdoor balcony. The breakfast room (included in the room rate) is located within your building. Staff were great but you really don’t see them. So if you like to look like a local and wander off the street into your Roman house then this is your spot. Your apartment is exactly where you want to stay in Rome. Basically in the middle of the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona. You are surrounded by shops, restaurants, amazing churches and gelato bars. We will definitely return for another “Roman Holiday”. Also a BIG TICK for FREE WIFI

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolefar84
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel on trip advisor and it suited our purposes perfectly. Prices were reasonable although the hotel is very attractive and the rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished. Definite plusses are the inclusion of a sumptuous breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sandyaosman
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, classic rooms small but clean with everything you need. Perfect location for walking to all the sites and shops. Breakfast very good with lots to choose from. Would definately return to this hotel if visiting Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location in centre of Rome - Good for a return trip”
Reviews.Author: GZandona
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Hotel Mozart in the Centre of Rome. All the mains attractions in Rome were within easy reach. We had very good rooms, very clean and quiet. The breakfast was very good and the staff very friendly towards us. We intend to go back to Rome and shall definitely return to the Mozart.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location! Warm Italian Hospitality! - Lush Rooftop Terrace....”
Reviews.Author: angelofthemorning
Reviews.Content: My Cousin and I just came back from Italy. Four of those days we stayed at The Hotel Mozart, in the Vivaldi Suite, Roma. We are extremely satisfied with our stay at The Hotel Mozart. To start off the reception desk people were very friendly and accomodating. They helped us with directions, gave us maps - and advised on forms of transportation...they were very friendly and happy to assist. We mostly talked to Cecidio and Gabrielle. Be sure to ask Cecidio about the Opera in the church around the corner which he recommended to us. The opera was one of the highlights of our trip. Also, The hotel is across the street from a conservatory, and you can hear the students practicing in the afternoon and evening....just wonderful! Loved it! Location is on Via Del Corso and pretty centrally located for Rome - a block from the Spanish Steps. Our room was spacious and comfortable and breakfasts were very nice - "Italian Style". We also loved sipping our Cosmo's at the charming roof-top terrace and enjoyed the lush gardens there. I was especially facinated by the huge Rosemary herb plants that we found there....the fragrance was beautiful. I say: "Great job to all...we felt at home and cared for at the Hotel Mozart....we will see you again!" Rosemary

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the suites which is around the...”
Reviews.Author: skay448
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the suites which is around the corner. Pluses and minuses: - elevator broken or not working. Had to walk up three flights of stairs. Didn't mind once we were situated but w luggage it was a pain + spacious and new with large flat screen and huge casement windows to open every morning as the city got busy. Felt like were more in an apartment than a hotel which we loved! + breakfast and fresh brewed coffee served en suite when u ring them up in them morning. We also asked for more of what we liked and none of what we didn't!

Reviews.Title: “only the roof is priceless )”
Reviews.Author: Nadya1010
Reviews.Content: the hotel is cozy & nice. we chose it due to its central location & we did not regret it.. the rooms small but clean, the breakffast simple... mostly I enjoyed the roof of the hotel with a charming view on central Rome.. the only minus is no internet & wifi.. only in the hall .. 2 stationary computers...

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel, in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yzabelletje
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart is a very charming hotel with excellent price/quality. The personnel is friendly and welcoming. We were lucky to stay in luxury, modern Vivaldi room (despite the funny tiny elevator). The roof top terrace was our favourite place for a relaxing drink after a long, beautiful day in Rome. Really a gem! The breakfast is nothing special, but everything is there for a good start of the day! I would definitely go back to this hotel for my next stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: AChitnis
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in late July 2010. Angelo (Front Office) was great. He was very helpful in guding us on things to do and was always gave a pateint hearing. But for this gentleman, I dont think, I would have had such a great stay. Others were a bit cold and did their job. The hotel is located on Via Del Corso and is very close to almost all the historical places and also the eating joints. I will definately recommend this hotel to all first time visitors to Rome. Happy travelling!! A Chitnis

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Roman Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: puffdotty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vittoria apartment of the Hotel Mozart and couldn't have been happier! We wanted more space than a hotel room since we were travelling with our seven-year-old, but we also wanted a homey place rather than something too fancy-schmancy for the same reason. The Vittoria apartment was perfect. It was very homey, like staying at grandma's in Brooklyn, rustic style wood furniture - but with free internet and Sky TV! (SpongeBob in Italian was a big hit!) There's a living room/dining area, kitchenette with a fridge, toaster-oven, and stove - but ask them how to work it 'cause we couldn't figure it out! (no microwave) A bedroom with major closets and drawers, and a bathroom with shower and even a bidet! There's a fantastic air conditioner in the bedroom, but the one in the living room stubbornly would'nt work - they tried to fix it and even brought in an electrician! But it was kaput, so they brought us a nice powerful fan, which worked out great. They even got us an alarm clock because the beds were so comfy and the windows kept the place so dark we never knew what time of day it was! The hotel front desk staff was AMAZING, as were the bellmen - they went out of their way to accomodate anything we needed, from fixing the AC, making a restaurant reservation, getting us Roma Passes, etc., etc. And always with a smile. I cannot stress enough how friendly and caring everyone was! Even the gals at the buffet breakfast - though busy, busy - were friendly. The food was replenished frequently so it was always fresh - even though we got there near the end! Coffee, tea, toast, croissants, quiche (yum!), boiled eggs, tarts, milk, juices, fruit, veggies, yogurts, cereal, cold cuts & cheese... and the breakfast room was lovely! And I should also mention that right across from the Vittoria apartment is a music school, so every day we were serenaded with opera singers and musicians practising - magical! The location is beautiful - a little cobblestone street just off the Via del Corso, surrounded by some terrific restaurants, shopping and sites. There's even a little grocery store just down the block - convenient for getting Cheerios and milk to take back to the apt! So here's the scoop: if you're looking for a super-lux experience, go to the Hassler, the Russie or the Excedra. But if you want an authentic Roman experience, the Mozart's Vittoria apartment is a great place to stay! Grazie mille!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel near Via Margutta, convenient to shopping, dining and walking everywhere."”
Reviews.Author: Ellens25
Reviews.Content: Although I associated it with writers, once among the world’s most brilliant, who’d drunk themselves into self-parody and premature death, Via Margutta is my favorite street in Rome. Whenever I’m in Rome - and admittedly it’s not that often - I make a point of walking down that beautiful, cobblestone street with its galleries and shops and looking carefully at Number 30, at the balcony where – if what Truman Capote wrote is true – his pet raven, Lola, perched on the edge of the stone balustrade and took her daily bath in a silver soup dish. Number 30 Villa Margutta does not rent out rooms, a few blocks away, on Via Dei Creci, the Hotel Mozart does.The selling point was the roof garden, and it did not disappoint. Lovely, intimate, three-level garden has rooftop bar with magnificent views. The room was somewhat small, but immaculate, with good linens and a nice fresco over the very comfortable bed. Two lights were out, including my reading light. The management said they'd replace the bulbs, but did not. And neither my husband nor I could figure out in three days how to regulate the water temperature in the jazuzzi shower. The management didn't help there, either. But small points, really, when compared to the perfect location, which by the way, is across the street from a music conservatory from which (during school hours) emanate sounds of opera singers practicing Mozart. And don't let the thought of rolling your suitcase down a cobblestone street bother you. The entrance is just a few steps from the Corso.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Suites”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunky2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Vivaldi Luxury Suites attached to the Hotel Mozart in Rome. We had wonderful service. The rooms are extremely large and furnished to a very high standard. We had a large balcony. You cannot stay without a visit to the rooftop bar at Hotel Mozart - simply stunning. Brilliant location, walking distance to metro and all the main attractions. You might want to note our room was next to a music conservatory, we loved it, but it might not be to everyone's liking. We would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ditch the Hotel mozart,try their fabulous Vivaldi Suites!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderernyc
Reviews.Content: My partner and i rocked up to Roma,with no bookings!!And no guidebook!!We did some quick review searches online,and came across the Vivaldi Suites.What concerns me ,always,in any city with old buildings,is the general poor quality of the buildings and the cramped interiors,the creaky bathrooms,the noise from the streets,and the smells! We were delighted and pleasantly surprised to find that our suite,which i think was No.6,in the furthest corner,was spectacular and great VFM-it was new,clean,with lots and lots of room,a clean,newly fitted out bathroom with a big tub and separate shower cubicle,which was also spacious.It overlooked an inner courtyard like space of some sort,so there was no noise.It was on a main busy street,so you stepped out into life at your doorstep!And,it was super secure-with entry codes and keys. We thought that the fact that Hotel Mozart,the parent company,was around the corner,would mean we would be neglected or ignored by the staff,but it simply wasnt true.In any case,we wanted for nothing.A carton of water bottles purchased by us from the Deli downstairs did the trick.I cant recall if there was room service. The only bugbears are carting the luggage up a flight of stairs(A porter did the honours when we checked in)AND the Vampire,who sits at the Hotel Mozart night desk,whose standard reply to everything is NO.But who needed him,anyways? :-)

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Terrace Wine Bar with a Priceless View”
Reviews.Author: Kaliescu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mozart for the first leg of our Honeymoon. The rooms were clean and the hotel has a great location for exploring Rome on foot. At night, we would go out to eat, grab some gelato on the way back to the hotel, and then hang out on the rooftop terrace. The bar staff is friendly, and it is a great place to enjoy a panoramic view of the city skyline with a bottle of pinot grigio!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and convenience”
Reviews.Author: SiciliaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Great location. The suites next door, part of the Mozart,called Vivladi Suites, are wonderfully roomy with personalized service. The location on Via del Corso, is very convenient for walks to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza de Popolo, many shops and great restaurants

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit”
Reviews.Author: tabbykins
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay in the Vittoria Apartment, we have also stayed in the hotel itself. We prefer the apartment for the space & privacy it affords. As others have said the location is great easy walk to most places you would want to visit, including St Peter's/Vatican & also Trastevere. For further afield the Spagna metro is close at hand. We have visited Rome many times but now always stay at this apartment. It is very spacious, nicely appointment with plenty of starge space. A previous reviewer said there was no heating, this is not the cae, there is heaters in both the lounge and the bedroom, operated by remote control. They're a bit tricky though but give out sufficent heat once you've mastered how to work them (the bellman who showed us to the apartment took the trouble to explain but I didn't pay proper attention). The breakfast is very good for this price of hotel & I always find it sets us up for the day. I like the home-made quiche & pastries they have. Not the healthiest option but we do walk it off all day! The apartment does not come equipt with a kettle or wine glasses. Both essential in my view. One of the breakfast ladies (they are ultra helpful & nice) quickly provided me with the wine glasses but it took longer to get a kettle although the front desk did set us up with one the next day. I have to say, I have seen a deterioration in the front desk staff over the years since the first visit. It's not bad but just that they were really good then but now it is a bit more of an effort. Also, I have to agree they do not acknowledge returning guests (or their special occasions, like special anniversaries, birthdays etc). Most hotels do & it is appreciated, it makes you feel appreciated. However, we did get a 10% discount as repeat guests & the rate is very reasonable anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The good outweighs the bad.”
Reviews.Author: StefR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vivaldi 2 bedroom Suite at the Hotel Mozart. The Vivaldi Apartments is actually 1/2 a block away from the Hotel Mozart. When we first booked this room I thought this distance might be a problem but it was none at all. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Its very well situated on the Via del Corso. Right on a busy shopping boulevard and a short walk from the Spanish Steps. When the windows were closed, I had no issues with noise even though the apartment was only one flight up. The worst thing about the hotel is the attitude from the front desk check in staff. Any time I dealt with them I got the distinct impression that they felt they were doing me a favor to even look up no less help me. It made me feel very uncomfortable. That said, I didn't get that same impression from the staff I dealt with that came to our room for various reasons. So I pressume its just the front desk staff that have this issue. The room itself is quite nice and well decorated. The large bedroom and adjoining bathroom is spacious and well appointed. The second bedroom and bath is much smaller but large enough for our purposes. The middle sitting room serves its purpose to eat breakfast, etc. If someone were planning on using that as a bedroom, it would make eating there very difficult as there would be no common area so keep that in mind. The closet turned into a kitchenette came in handy. No stove to cook but a little fridge to store cold foods and drinks. There are televisions in both bedrooms and sitting rooms. There is a single sky cable box for the apartment which means only one of us got to enjoy any programming at one time. On the positive side there is a DVD player in each room so if you'd like some rainy day entertainment, you could bring or buy DVDs. Another issue we had throughout our stay was that the cable would go out every once in a while. Not a big issue except for the fact that the telephone and internet service would go down when that would happen. We found the internet connection to be virtually unusable throughout our stay. If it had been working properly, that would have been a nice touch. A nice breakfast of coffee, croissant, cereal and fruit was served to us each day. Was very happy with the quality and service there. Overall a nice stay but a few small improvements on the service and amenities would make such a tremendous difference. If I had had better front desk service and reliable cable/phone line, I would have given 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Crouchie03
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior Suite (essentially a large room) for 8 nights. The room was comfortable and included a big plasma television. The beds were so comfortable we ended organising wake up calls every morning so we didn't oversleep. There was a Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom which was great after a long day of walking around the sites. The room also had an outdoor terrace, with table and chairs and plenty of pot plants. This was a great place to relax with a few drinks or a snack in privacy. The rooms could do with a bit of updating but we were still very comfortable. There is free internet access and the hotel had computers available for use - which was great as we travelled without laptops. The location couldn't have been better. We literally walked everywhere - the Trevi, Spanish Steps, even the Colesseum (although this was a good 45 minute walk). There were no issues with noise as the hotel is located in a quiet street just off the main thoroughfare.We found most of the staff quite friendly, and I have never seen people work so hard as the staff at breakfast - which was great. Although there is no room service or restaurant in the hotel, there were plenty of places close to the hotel to eat. We would definately stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Vittoria Suite”
Reviews.Author: AssiaMoscow
Reviews.Content: Suite it is perfectly located in silent street between Via del Corso and Via Babuiono. Apartment spacious enough for three person. There is a free Internet with the laptop. TV with satellite channels. In each room the conditioner. A good spacious bathroom with a shower. The small kitchen with all necessary equipment, is even the dishwasher, here only there are no tablets for it. That on kitchen there were old sponges for ware washing Not so was pleasant. The breakfast passes in hotel Mozart, good enough, but not so various - a ham and cheese always one grade, egg only boiled, but it is a lot of Sweet batch. Suite the parlourmaid every day cleans. The unique negative that in rooms in the winter coldly enough (heating is not present), and floors stone, therefore to us even was necessary to buy тапки. The general impression - is excellent

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience- great location”
Reviews.Author: ready2travel09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely Mozart hotel on NOV 20th for 3 nites- very friendly staff; perfect location and the BEST breakfast on our entire Italian trip. Would defiantely go back and reccomend it whole heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “So wonderful Mozart”
Reviews.Author: babywim
Reviews.Content: Hi all, i hope u guys can remember me, my friends and i (3 Thai girls) stayed in your hotel for 4 nights. Everyday i felt so happy with your hotel; all staff are so kind, nice and helpful. My friends and i've got so much help from every staff. Moreover, the hotel is not too big, but the decoration is so beautiful, clean, and breakfast is so yummy. We love everything in this hotel and we surely will stay in this hotel again when we visit Rome. Furthermore, the last day when we check out, we faced the accident; were hit by a car; then the hotel staff help us and asked us to stay without pay anything until we felt better. My friends and i love this hotel so much. Thanks so much for the help 3 Thai girls

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ahuva
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart is on a very small pedestrian street, Via de' Greci, which connects the Via del Corso and Via del Babuino.It is a charming cobblestone street, but VERY DIFFICULT to take a suitcase on; therefore, since the taxi couldn't get into the street, and could only stop on the Via del Babuino side which is the farthest side from the entrance, it wasn't easy to drag along a suitcase on wheels. Take that into account if you are carrying a large and/or heavy bag. Once inside, the hotel is very pleasant, but the room I asked for- a double for single use, overlooking an internal courtyard (number 322)- meant that one had to go up and down some small staircases, and without help from a bellboy, it would have been a bit difficult. Also, the courtyard was actually the back of a neighboring house. I was lucky to see a terrace covered with plants and flowers, but it could also have had laundry hanging out. The room was a decent size, had good hanging space, but one thing lacking was the absence of proper drawer space.Nor was there a full length mirror in the room, only 2 three quarter length mirrors. One other thing that was strange were the rather old fashioned telephones, which didn't allow for a flashing message sign or voice mail. Since cellphones do not work at all in the hotel, one must use the land line.Lastly, the lighting was not very good, so much so that one evening I selected a pair of tights thinking they were black, and only when I got outside did I discover they were purple! But now for the good parts: the room was generally comfortable,particularly the bed, which had an excellent mattress, though the pillows were a bit too soft for my liking. The bathroom, which had a laundry line in the shower, always a great convenience, was a nice size and had good amenities/ The hotel has a marvelous roof garden, open only in the summer, but I was able to see it, and enjoy the amazing view over the city.In the winter, there is a lovely lounge and bar available in the afternoon and evenings with comfortable couches, a tv, newspapers, internet point, and generally a very cozy atmosphere. There is also a little cafe/restaurant attached to the hotel, called La Luna d'Oro, which many people from the neighborhood frequent. It is open till 9 pm, and they give a small discount to hotel guests. The breakfast room is decorated in pale green and the staff even wear shirts to match, to complete the feeling of cool charm. The choice for breakfast is fairly good, but, as a vegetarian, it would have been nice to have smoked sliced salmon and not just sliced meat available.By Italian standards it was a very nice breakfast, with fresh fruits and vegetables available besides the usual bread, cereal and pastry fare. What was very nice was the fact that at the buffet table each person could fill a whole tea/coffeee pot and take it to the table, thus having enough without having to bother to get up or ask the staff. The hotel also provides another room in the basement with 3 internet points, all for use without payment. The one thing that is confusing is the separation of 2 different elevators for different floors. The staff was courteous, but I cannot say that they went out of their way to be extremely helpful, and that despite the fact that I speak fluent Italian and have no problem of communication. Nonetheless, I would certainly recommend the hotel highly and go back myself. It is a perfect location and very convenient for both walking and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: roeroeg
Reviews.Content: What a shame. This is a beautiful little hotel in a good location. We stayed here for three nights in October. PROBLEM: The day receptionist was extemely rude to say the least. We awoke every morning at 7:30 to the sound of major construction. The front desk young man told us that there was no construction going on in the hotel. The construction took place directly BELOW our room. The hotel manager said they would change our room but the young man was annoyed because I complained to his supervisor and purposely neglected to change our room. We were there for the 3 nights. He also never mailed the post cards we gave him. Prior to this problem, he was reluctant and annoyed to give directions and would only respond by handing you a map. Financial consideration was made for the room by the hotel manager when he saw that our room was not changed. We were pleased at that. The night staff was pleasant and helpful unlike the day staff. We stayed in 5 hotels throughout Italy. All were warm and wonderful. A hotel is only as nice as the people who represent it.

Reviews.Title: “Our Last Visit with The Mozart”
Reviews.Author: muddsmom
Reviews.Content: Sadly, after staying at The Mozart at least six or more times over the years, we have decided that we will no longer stay there. We actually like the hotel and location very much, but have decided that the snooty front desk people are just inexcusable. This has been a complaint from many people who have reviewed this hotel in the past, but we always chose to excuse their behavior because we loved the hotel itself. We just returned from a week long trip to Tuscany and stayed at The Mozart for two nights before our flight home. During this and our last several stays, we have stayed in the Vivaldi Suites, which we like very much. They are always spotless and the bathrooms are very nice and modern. The first thing we always do is turn on the air conditioner and this time, we found the motor sounded like a jet taking off. We decided that this was not acceptable and called the desk to see if there was another room. They replied that they were totally booked, but would send someone to check it out. We didn't leave the room for several hours and as far as we know, no one ever came to look at it. Once the room cooled down, we kept it on low and it was better, but still rather loud. I must admit that we have never found the front desk help overly friendly, but as long as they did their job and we liked the hotel, we tolerated their aloofness. When we arrived, our room was not ready and they said it would only take twenty minutes, so we waited right there in the lobby where they could see us. After half an hour, my husband asked if our room was ready and the guy looked at him like he didn't know what he was talking about and asked what our name was. I think what has always irritated me the most over the years, was how they NEVER once acknowedged that we had stayed there before. Most hotels say, "Welcome Back Mr. and Mrs. so and so," but they have never said a word. I actually think that is very rude, especially after half a dozen stays or more and the terrific reviews I have given them on Trip Advisor. Lastly, when we were checking out, my husband asked if they could give him change for the driver and the guy said in a very rude manner, "I don't have change." I think that nailed the coffin shut as far as we were concerned. Let me add, that almost every single one of these people has worked there for as long as we have stayed there, so these aren't untrained people. I think we have probably stayed with them more than any other guest, so a little warmth would have been nice. So, when we return to Rome, we will no longer consider The Mozart. Very sad, but I think guests deserve good help at the front desk. If they don't like their jobs, I'm sure there are others in Rome who would jump at the chance at working there!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and close to everything near Spanish Steps!”
Reviews.Author: LDFL
Reviews.Content: will return! Comfy bed, english speaking staff, wonderful breakfast, terrace with bolganvia, steps from the "Steps" Loved the tile floors in the entire room. The windows open out after you open the shutters, we could hear the city sounds, music playing next year. We went in 2001, our 10 year and my 40th.....this application does not let you pick older than 2006. Found this on the net all on my own...

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonO007
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. We stayed in for 5 days in Vivaldi Apartments. Big room with big LCD , friendly stuff and super location ! 5 min to Piaza de Popolo , same distance to Piaza de Spagna and 10 min to Piaza de Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: gothicgirl021
Reviews.Content: Top Location Large Rooms Fantastic Service Clean Rooms Highly Reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Good location; helpful staff; nice roooms for price.”
Reviews.Author: JulieBWilmingtonNC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart is convenient to bus at Plaza Popolo (sp?). Buy Roma pass for museum discounts. Arrange guide for Vatican or you will wait hours in line. At Colosseum you can get a guide on-site for 10euro and avoid lines.

Reviews.Title: “great with kids”
Reviews.Author: miamimom1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Mozart at end of a wonderful, long, 2 week vacation in Italy. Great way to end it. our room was huge and so was the bathroom, our 4 year old daughter loved it because there was plenty of room for her to dance around while we were getting ready to venture out. Great A/C for the HOT summer months. The rooftop bar was our meeting place every evening before we went out to dinner and after for an after dinner drink (or two). Breakfast was ample, they didn't mind when you asked for a cappucino or two. Excellent location, we walked everywhere and plenty of shops for all budgets.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to everything!!”
Reviews.Author: tennis446
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart was a great hotel and would totally recommend to all ages. It had a very cute roof top bar and place to have dinner which over looked all the roof tops of Rome. We went there most nights after we got back to our hotel from a night out. Good AC and clean and was handy for all the shopping, resturants and sights. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveller095
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. We had two rooms for four ladies. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great. Location was absolutely perfect. Within walking distance to most places you would want to see. Mere steps from main shopping street and scores of fabulous restaurants. Rooms are a good size and quiet. Free internet was a great bonus. Ending every evening having drinks on the roof top terrace was a trip highlight. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: irenelizza
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the vivaldi apartment portion of this hotel. It is actually right on the street in a great location near the Spanish Steps. It is almost directly across the street from a tourist bus stop which can take you all around the city to all the major sites. The rooms were comfortable and spacious and had great air conditioning. The staff, especially the front desk and manager, were extremely nice and friendly and helpful. The breakfast that is provided was so plentiful and delicious, you are not hungry again until dinner. I will never stay at another hotel in Rome. They even have a laptop in the room for you with free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: lizaed77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was above and beyond anything we could have hoped for. The staff was helpful, the location was perfect and the room was amazing. The giant LCD TV with satellite, the in room jacuzzi, and breakfast delivered to your room every morning are just a few of the perks that we enjoyed. But there were so many more like the plush bath robes and slippers, the DVD player, in room laptop, cell phone, and free bike rental that we didn't even get a chance to enjoy... so we have to go back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nandabel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Mozart on my third leisure visit to Rome and it was by far the most memorable of my trips there. We arrived in the late evening and the concierge was extremely friendly and helped us find a great restaurant near the hotel that was open late for dinner. The hotel is situated just steps from the Piazza di Spagna and walking distance from other sites as well as plenty of shopping. The room was very clean and comfortabable and the breakfast buffet made me feel like I was home! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Aimee3601
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart is situated in a fantastic location just off Via del Corso and near the Spanish steps. The staff are friendly and helpful--they helped us book cars to the airport and took care of dinner reservations as well as providing many other suggestions for things to do/see. The rooms are small but cozy and elegantly furnished. A first-rate hotel in a fabulous location!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: yevheny
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel with a couple of friends over the weekend in May 2009. Mozart has the best location (less than 5 minutes walk from both Spanish stairs and Piazza del Popolo) and its windows face the quiet street while the entrance is just 10 m away from central street Via Corso. The rooms are great and look extremely romantic with beautiful old-fashioned furniture. Hotel's staff was extremely helpful both by providing us with addresses of great restaurants and by ironing the clothes on time. To sum up my feelings - this hotel definitely has its soul (as most of the things in this beautiful city) and I will recommend it to my friends and stay there myself next time I'm in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartments”
Reviews.Author: justthreeofus
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant time here. We stayed in one of the hotels apartments away from the main hotel on via rippetta. It was really nice. You walk into the apartment and you are in the lounge/dining room with a plasma tv and air con. Then through a little passage where the kitchen is, very small but has everything you need. A fully stocked fridge, coffee maker with loads of coffee pads, kettle ,pots and pans even a dishwasher. You have breakfast in your room as you are away from the main hotel, thats why the fridge is stocked with all sorts of things to eat. The next room is the large bedroom with walkin wardrobe and the bathroom with jacuzzi bath. There is also access to a small balcony with no view but the great apartment makes up for that. We loved the central location of the apartment, places to eat nearby, but not cheap to eat out. We would maybe consider halfboard next time to save a few bob. Rome is fantastic, cant wait to go back and we will be staying here again too.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience... Consider other Hotels”
Reviews.Author: TripAdv1234567
Reviews.Content: We have been to Italy many times and have normally stayed with my family or in other hotels. On this trip, we wanted to try Hotel Mozart. The location is excellent and the price is very reasonable. We stayed for 5 nights at the beginning of our trip and 1 night before we left Italy. The first 5 nights were great. We were in a recently remodeled room. It was very clean and nice. The bathroom was tiny but normal for european hotels. The breakfast was also very good. When we returned to the hotel about a week later for our last night, they told us we would be staying in an apartment a few blocks away. I objected and said I booked a room but they assured me this was an "upgrade" and to just wait and see the "beautiful apartment." The apartment was not clean, tired and shabby, in a building with no security at all and a bit of a walk from where we thought we would be staying. When I complained, they put us in a room in the hotel. Next, I realize there is a tub only and the shower nozzle was completely broken. I went right back downstairs to complain again and they looked at me like I was crazy and said "you mean to tell us that you wanted a room with a shower?" I said YES!, I want a room with a shower. So now they put us in a room below their rooftop bar and assured me that it wouldn't be too noisy after 12:30am because the party being held there should be done with by then. Needless to say, they put us in a semi-acceptable room. I liked the hotel during our first few nights, but the experience on the last day ruined it for me. I have stayed in several other hotels in Rome and would consider staying elsewhere before Mozart again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Most 4 Stars, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gaetano_007
