Reviews.Content: Loved the location, the breakfast buffet with homemade goodies, large rooms with great TV options. The rooftop terrace is gorgeous. Only downside, the staff are very Roman, and I think are a little put out with American tourists and their needs.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Suites were amazing for family of 6”
Reviews.Author: lynnhill
Reviews.Content: Vivaldi Suites were perfect for our family of 4 adults 1 teen and 1 toddler. The location was perfect, we walked to every Rome attraction, furthest being 30 minute walk to Vatican but it was a beautiful and easy walk. The rooms were very big and very clean. The staff was amazing and helpful to first timers to Italy. The breakfast was served in our rooms every morning. Over all perfect experience, can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good visit with a niggle”
Reviews.Author: Holmeschapel
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel are mainly justified. Good location, quiet and comfortable room (224) overlooking central well and blissfully away from traffic noise. Welcoming and helpful staff in the breakfast room. Varied breakfast with good coffee if you choose espresso or capucchino. The only "cooked" items were hard boiled eggs! The welcome sign did not extend to one member of the reception staff who has yet to learn that the guests help to pay his salary. The others were fine. The niggle was about the television. Excellent flat screen. The hotel stated that it used the Sky satellite system. If so, why was it not possible to see the English versions of Sky news, CNN or CNBC. The only English channel was BBC World which must have really impressed the American visitors!! This is not a cheap hotel so there was no excuse for the unavailability of those channels

Reviews.Title: “Quite pleasant, great location”
Reviews.Author: Constance01
Reviews.Content: Pleasant, well-appointed accommodations, congenial staff, reasonably priced for a wonderful location. Beautiful rooftop terrace and salon. Easy walking distance to Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain. Bus stops close by and public transit easy to navigate. Room and bathroom were very nice. (Generally speaking, don't expect big rooms in Europe as you might in a comparable U.S. hotel. I don't think this would be an issue except for a larger family or group.) It was just perfect for our holiday. This comment has nothing to do with the hotel: For tourists, we would recommend getting a RomaPass when you arrive at the airport (for bus fare and discounts on museums, exhibits). We read these were available at tobbaco shops, but did not find anywhere that sold these in the city. Bus fares are still very reasonable without the RomaPass, but the museum/exhibit discounts would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Suites - Perfection”
Reviews.Author: dr_steve_l
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vivaldi Suites of the Hotel Mozart for two nights prior to our cruise and for four nights after our cruise. When we arrived our rooms were not ready because it was too early to check in. The staff offered us a breakfast at the hotel and a place to clean up after our overnight flight from New York City. After breakfasting on meat, cereal, pastry and coffee, we left our bags at the hotel where they were put in storage and went out exploring the vicinity. The hotel is near the Spanish Steps and many fine shops and restaurants. We wanted to visit the Galleria Borghese, but it wasn't open during the time prior to our cruise. The person at the front desk was quite helpful in making a reservation to the Galleria for when we returned. The staff throughout our stay did everything within their power to make our stay enjoyable, sometimes going out of their way to do so. The suites were immaculate with shower, tub and jacuzzi in the bathrooms, very large flat screen TV and satellite reception in the bedroom/sitting room and a laptop computer in the room for our use. The accommodations were easily the equivalent of a suite at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas or any fine hotel. Room service is included in the cost of the room and every morning a tray would arrive with the cereal, fruit, yogurt, rolls, pastry and cappucino that we ordered. The bathrooms came with bath gel, shampoo, hair dryer, good lighting, electrical outlets, etc. The rooms were large and airy. Although the room faced the street (via del Corso) there was no street noise when the windows were closed. Air conditioning took care of the temperature control at night. During the day the windows were opened allowing fresh air in. We enjoyed our stay and plan to stay there again when we are next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sophiebnyc
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Italy and stayed at the Hotel Mozart in Rome for 3 days. As an older woman traveling solo, I am always looking for nice places to stay that don't break the bank. The Hotel Mozart was lovely. Although the single room (like all single rooms in Europe) was small, it was immaculate, air conditioned, and had a safe, mini bar and TV. The staff were pleasant and very professional. Wonderful breakfast. The location is central, just three blocks from the Spanish Steps. I would definitely stay there again. New York City

Reviews.Title: “Romantic place”
Reviews.Author: Gorizont
Reviews.Content: Welcome was very pleasant in the first place. A drink was offered as soon as we arrived in this lovely lobby. The room was quite small but very elegant, well equipped. The same can be said of the bathroom, which contained many little details such as sweet soaps, beauty and care products, all these little gifts that ladies will appreciate. Breakfast was not really special but served in the nice bar, in a friendly atmosphere. Very central (in between Piazza del Populo, Piazza Spania and Pantheon). Good choice for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Mozart”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom12
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our trip to Italy and Greece and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Mozart in Rome! The room was very large (even by U.S. standards) and had no problem accommodating two adults and two children. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was delicious! I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and totally agree with all the wonderful reviews. I would stay here again happily. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!”
Reviews.Author: TRossi81
Reviews.Content: I visited the Hotel Mozart as part of my honeymoon visit to Rome and we loved every minute of it. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful in letting you know the local restaurant and attractions that have the best reputation and not too expensive. Our room was small however very clean and simply in there decor and we really couldn't complain. Overall it was a fantastic stay and they made it very special for us.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting décor, if a little OTT!”
Reviews.Author: Telfordsmama
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked a really cheap package - and what good value it was! The Mozart is very central, close to the main shopping street and most of the tourist venues, including the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, Pantheon etc etc. Colosseum was just a short hop by bus, Vatican within walking distance. As we had booked a package and couldn't choose the type of accommodation, we were given a small room which was decorated as though Mozart was actually living there - 18th century style! The bathroom was a bit smelly, but this improved when the shower was used... The reception staff were excellent - they always remembered our names and recommended some really good restaurants, which we would never have found by chance.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: travel JR
Reviews.Content: Great location outside of some of the madness of Rome's busiest tourist areas. Yet, it is only a few blocks from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and reasoanble walk to almost everywhere else (Vatican, Colosseum). If you can afford it, book a room with balcony...these rooms are huge and have nice baths and balconies. We saw one non balcony room and it was on the small side, but much mroe typical of Italy hotels than our big room! The front desk people were quite variable re: helpfulness. Difficult to tell if it was all language or some attitude thrown in. Other reviewers have praised breakfast as one of best in Rome...perhaps it is...but overall it was not easy to find great food in Rome. Breakfast was certainly adequate for a busy day... Overall, a very good place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxed and genuine experience”
Reviews.Author: chazpraz
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Rome. I had researched very little about hotels but settled for the Mozart due to proximity to the Spanish Steps. The hotel is an excellent choice with attentive staff, a nice breakfast, complementary internet and bicycles and a delightful rooftop cantina. The hotel is tucked away off Via Del Corso which is the equivalent of a more quaint 5th Avenue or Michigan Avenue. The Metro light rail is a five minute walk and will take you to all major sites. Shopping and restaurants are nearby and offer a wide variety of styles, cuisines and budgets. If you prefer a more grandiose hotel with a large lobby this is not your place. However, if you prefer a quiet, relaxed and genuine experience Mozart fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Mozart”
Reviews.Author: christiffer
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Mozart, and our fourth to Rome. The first time was excellent, but then we had a suite - so were a little interested to see what a standard room was like. In fact it seemed brand new, very tastefully decorated, decent in size and benefited from not having the balcony over via del corso that we had before ! The bathroom was more than a little smelly however .. I think this might be to do with the ancient sewer system in rome rather than the hotel ... The breakfast is a bit of a scrum - but given its not an Italian specialty - OK. The is no nightlife in the hotel that we could detect, and of course no restaurant - but then why come to Rome and eat in the hotel? The staff have good tips for restaurants. Bottom line is this hotel is very well situated for shopping and sightseeing and although you might find more luxurious hotels ... eg the Cavailieri Hilton.. they typically are out of town - or much more expensive

Reviews.Title: “What a great location”
Reviews.Author: alinaSP
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on a number of different sites for more than 50 hotels in central Rome, we decided to book a room for three at Hotel Mozart. When you read so many reviews it gets very confusing, and you basically must make a decision on what is most important to you and your family. For a week-long visit to Rome location is everything. Hotel Mozart is situated 15 minutes from the Trevi Fountain, 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps, another five in the opposite direction is Piazza Popolo, 20 minutes away the Pantheon, 30 the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. Rooms were a good size, clean, great beds, brand-new marble bathrooms, better than we expected from a 3 star hotel. Another plus: the hotel offers a hearty breakfast not only the traditional cakes and pastries with coffee. We were given some great recommendations for dinner from the gentlemen working at the front desk, especially Claudio who sent us to a very nice tratoria in Trastevere. As one reviewer has mentioned, cars can not pull up in front of the hotel, but the walk from the main street Via del Corso, is less than a minute, and we never had to carry our bags, the bell-boy was always helpful and courteous. The taxi stand is 5 minutes from the hotel, and the closest bus stop only 2 minutes on Via del Corso. We had a great vacation in Rome and we look forward to coming back one day and staying at the Mozart again. The Romans are very polite and courteous and they expect the same of everyone else, and remembering that will make your experience in Rome even better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Roman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFinn
Reviews.Content: I had a long weekend holiday with wife and two friends. The Hotel is located very practically and is very clean and neat. The rooms are big enough even though the view wasn't the best from the first floor. Breakfast was OK and staff was very friendly. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jen583
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vivaldi luxury rooms, they were amazing, it was like our own apartment! We had a massive comfy bed, a sofa a huge bathroom with jacuzzi bath and large separate shower. The breakfast was great. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly and its location in rome was perfect for all the sites! There is some lovely restaurants near by too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the complimentary cocktail!”
Reviews.Author: AHopeLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: We hadn't read any reviews of the Hotel Mozart but the travel agent recommended it as a good three star boutique hotel so we went ahead and booked it for three nights. It is very close to the spanish steps and the metro station and is just off the Via del corso on the Via dei greci. Lots of expensive shoe, clothes and bag shops if that's your thing! It is also near a good variety of restaurants and is well placed for exploring the city. We were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Our double room was fairly large, with a decent bathroom and good size shower. Everything was very clean and, crucially, it was air-conditioned, which given it was 35 degrees outside, was lovely to return to after a day sight-seeing in Rome! Staff were very helpful, professional and friendly, apart from one rather moody bar tender! The terrace bar on the roof, which is open in the summer, had a lovely view across the rooftops of Rome in the evening and the complimentary cocktail was perfect! Breakfast was buffet style and included cold cuts, cheese, yoghurt, croissants, cereal, juice, tea and coffee and kept us going till our slice of pizza at lunchtime! Overall, we thought that this hotel was very good value for money and would recommend it to anyone wanting a city break in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam55Essex
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a romantic trip to Rome. The Hotel Mozart was a lovely hotel with lots of charm in a perfect location just round the corner from the Spanish Steps and Metro station. We could walk to most attractions from there. Getting around was easy. We bought a 3 day pass for Metro which also allowed us to use buses in that time. Taxi's can only be got from Taxi ranks, but these are in all the popular spots. Rough guide cost wise : It cost us 8 euros from Spanish Steps to Termini Station. St Peters Square to Hotel was 12 Euros. Our room was clean with well equipped bathroom. a little small, but not enough to bother us. Room had kettle and vrious teas/coffee facilities. Also had a stocked mini bar, TV with Sky (some channels were able to be switched from Italian to English language-some not), DVD player and various toiletries. Continental breakfast included , with cereals, toast, pastries, meat,cheese, fruit, yoghurt etc. Reception staff very friendly. would recommend. one little tip - we were a bit wary at first for fear of being ripped off, but if you go to the Vatican, take advantage of a tour when they come up to you in the queue. the tour was fantastic and our guide, Mike, was great. it cost us 40 euros each, but we cut the queue and went straight in, had an Australian guide and live audio guide all the way round-not pre-recorded. if we hadnt done this tour, we would have just wandered round not knowing what we were looking at and also got lost as it's huge in there! well worth the money. one more thing, when eating out, they give you a bread basket. if you eat any of it, you will be charged, but if you dont, you wont. Enjoy Rome- it's fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ali24
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on trip advisor and they were mixed, but as it was a very convenient location and they offered us an apartment which accommodated our two kids and my husand and I we took a gamble. But what a surprise....! It was fantastic. The location was the absolute best we could have found and our apartment was amazing. Very very modern with plasma screens in each bedroom and dvd players, lovely decor, jacuzzzi bath (which the kids loved) two bathrooms a small kitchen and living room with a pull out bed, where our ten year old slept, so it meant we all had our own rooms to sleep in. The staff were so helpful and made dinner recommendations and reservations for us each night which were just brilliant, delicious food, not too far away and well priced home cooked cuisine. Breakfast every morning was brought to the room and the trolley filled with warm, filing pastries, eggs, cheese and rolls, just perfect. Rome was beauitful but Hotel Mozart made it even more pleasurable, convenient and a great place to relax at the end of very hectic days walking. I highly recommend it......!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: juliensap
Reviews.Content: There are many issues with this hotel . I am sure that many can see past them if their expectations are extremely low. Firstly, there is no street access to the hotel so expect to down via de greci with all your luggage or get a taxi to drop you off on via del corso. Either way, it is very inconvenient. The front desk staff were rude and unhelpful. One staff member suggested we go to a restaurant (and even claimed to have made reservations) that did not open at all that evening. The hotel has wireless internet access that is accessible only from the hotel lobby (there is a couch in the lobby but no outlets). They have three workstations on the internet for public use but all traffic is monitored and the small room is uncomfortable. The hotel itself is a maze. In order to get from either elevator to a room requires going up or down a number of steps. Additionally, the floors in the room and the halls are tile making every footstep and conversation audible to all residents on the floor. This hotel does not enforce the smoking ban so do not expect a smoke-free environment. The hotel definitely has the best TV system but that did not make up for the other horrid inadequacies. We stayed one night of our 6 night reservation and found better accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Elite apartments are excellent for a family.”
Reviews.Author: faroadviser
Reviews.Content: Our family, two adults and two youths stayed at Ripetta suites, which belong to Hotel Mozart, a second floor in via di Ripetta. A room with a queen bed and a living room with a sofa bed for two persons, a kitchenette and a bathroom. It is excellent for a family but inconvenient for four persons not of the same family, as one has to go across the bedroom to get into the bathroom. This is better than a private apartment because we have daily housekeeping service and the necessary for breakfast (yogurts milk, coffee, juices, mineral water, bread, butter, jams and pastries). An espresso machine was very useful, pity there wasn't a microwave. There wasn't a lift but it seems the building will soon have one as it was being arranged. We felt absolutely safe in this beautiful apartment as can be seen on the photos. It is beautifully located, near Augustus mausoleum not far from Via del Corso (one of the main shopping streets)

Reviews.Title: “Central but noisy”
Reviews.Author: DesignerOslo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a norwegian newpaper as a charming, central hotel i Rome. The price is ok, so I booked it for a surprise trip for me and my other half. We got a tiny doubbleroom with a nice bathrooms, and satelite tv. The bed cover looked a little old and in need of drycleaning, which is not pleasant. Otherwise the room was clean and nice.The hotel was under refurbishment, which was very noisy and irritating. Allthough we spent most of the day out in Rome, it is nice to return to a quiet room for som rest, but that was impossible with all the noise. I wish they had told me when I was e -mailing them, regarding the reservations. When I asked for a refund, they offered to take the minibar bill, which was only a few euros.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: IndyCleanfreak
Reviews.Content: After staying at a Bed & Breakfast in Florence, we were very disappointed in the cleanliness of the room and bathroom for the price. When I entered the room, I found a tea kettle...."what a treat hot tea"...I thought. Well that was not to be...when I opened the lid, the tea kettle was filled with milky, moldy water. Next morning, I showed the tea kettle to the maid and all she did was shrug and dumped out the water in the sink and handed it to me. Ugg, I could of done that. Also, the shower didn't drain properly so it overflowed onto the floor. I'm just glad that the floor had a drain...but be careful you can slip and fall....

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: CTS29
Reviews.Content: Having read numerous reviews I wasn't sure what to expect on arriving at Hotel Mozart however I can honestly say we were pleasantly surprised. We booked an executive (double) room and it was fantastic. Huge room complete with 42" plasma screen as well as a balcony with a table and chairs. The staff were friendly enough, the breakfast was great and it was all within easy distance of all the sites (other than the Vatican for which we jumped on the metro one way and walked back). The only thing I would suggest is that you don't rely on advice from the front desk staff. On the two ocassions we asked about what time something opened/started they were completely wrong. It would be best to do your own investigation. Other than that though, would highly recommend a stay there. (Oh, and they have free internet!)

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Suites were great”
Reviews.Author: mbspitale
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights with a large group in the Vivaldi Suites in December. The rooms were wonderful- very spacious with breakfast in your room every morning. The hotel was very centrally located (a very short walk from the Spanish Steps) and on a fairly busy street. One of our 3 rooms was right on the street and made it a little difficult to sleep, while the other two were in the back of the building and very quiet. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “it was okay...”
Reviews.Author: geminigirl24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel mozart nov 10 - 15. A car picked us up from the airport (arranged by the hotel) with no problem. A previous poster was right about the check-in - not overly friendly. usually i don't mind however after a long flight and in a foreign country, you want to feel welcomed at your hotel. Upon entering the room, there was a horrible smell of ammonia (i suppose from cleaning the room). we had to leave the windows open the whole day in order to get the smell out. The room was an okay size, small by american standards but i suppose okay for european rooms. the first night i wanted to use the computer to notify family that we had arrived. well, the computer would not allow sign in to any email accounts. i asked the front desk and he said the technician wouldn't be back until monday (this was saturday). later that evening we asked again, and we were told there is another computer room downstairs with 3 computers... and those worked fine. it would have been to know about this room when we checked in, or told about it when i complained about the other computer not working. we also had a problem with the shower. the drain would not drain and kept clogging up, so that every couple minutes in the shower i had to turn the water off to let it drain and then put it back on. We notified the front desk several times, several times they told us it was fixed, however it never was (nor was there any evidence that they came or fixed anything). This was a bit annoying, as after a long day of touring i look forward to a nice long shower, and this could not happen without flooding the bathroom. At breakfast, the selection was typical - rolls, croissants, jellies, some fruit. However you had to ask one of the women to order a cappucino, and i felt you had to flag them down as they were running around the breakfast room. they didn't seem thrilled when you asked for one, and they do not ask you if you'd like anything when you arrive. the first day we were polite and waited to be asked, and then realized that no one was going to ask us so we had to get their attention ourselves. The hotel's location is probably the best thing it has going for it - minutes away from the spanish steps and right on via del corso. however be careful, because our room faced via del corso and it was pretty noisy all day (if in the room) and at night as well. i suppose they have rooms that face the back but we weren't in one of those. the front desk was helpful once you started talking to them, but not overly friendly. Overall, the hotel was clean, room a decent size, in a good location, however I just did not get a warm feeling from this hotel, and i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Mozart”
Reviews.Author: Auntnikki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mozart the first 4 days of our honeymoon and we could not have been HAPPIER. The location is excellent, 2 minutes from the Spanish Steps and walking distance to all the sights. We walked to every tourist sight with NO problem. If you like to shop, you will love this location. The best thing we did was e-mail the hotel directly and book a car to pick us up from the airport. When we picked our luggage up from baggage claim and walked outside, the driver was standing there with a sign (saying our name) and drove us right to the hotel's front door. It was excellent and only 65 euro (a taxi would have costed a fortune becuase we sat in traffic). We also reserved a car back to the airport for our trip home and it costs 53 Euro (door to door service). The rooms were very clean (we stayed in a Superior room) and on the larger size. The wine bar on the roof was our favorite, we went every night for after dinner drinks...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In One of the Best Areas of the City”
Reviews.Author: WonderMan3
Reviews.Content: Had a two night stay at Hotel Mozart following a cruise. We arrived around 11am and room was ready. Check-in was professional but not overly friendly. Bell-man took us to the room which was on the top floor. He then promptly brought the bags up after. We booked a Deluxe Room. Room was very spacious with two beds pushed together into one, forming a king. There were two balconies, one huge one off of the bed area with a table, two chairs, umbrella, and two lounge chairs. (One lounge chair had a broken arm though and the umbrella was completely ratty and worn out.) It looked down onto the Via Del Corso. The other balcony was smaller off of the bathroom and had the rear view from the hotel out to the Villa Borghese. There was central A/C, a large plasma/LCD type TV with satellite channels and DVD player (PAL not NTSC), mini-bar, in-room coffee/tea set-up, and ample drawer space and large closet. Bathroom was large with multi-head shower/jacuzzi tub and bidet. Room was clean save for a line of mildew that was growing at the top of the shower. Bed was very comfortable and A/C worked well. The only note with that is the room's power is controlled by your room key. When you leave, you have to take the key out of the outlet which turns off all power. So you may come back to the room being hot and have to wait for it to cool off again. Hotel has an odd layout. You have to take an elevator or stairs up one flight from the lobby, then cross over through the lounge to find a second elevator to get to higher floors. It seemed like it might be difficult for a handicapped individual to get around. Breakfast buffet is included and it was okay. There were breads, cakes, pastries, fruit, and some meats and cheese. Some hot items would've been nice though. You can also get room service breakfast for an additional cost. There is a large two-level roofdeck with wonderful views. We didn't use that often since we had our own balcony. There was a bar on the roofdeck. We had a free welcome drink included with our room so we went up one evening to use it. We had been up before and it was a very relaxing atmosphere with nice background music and people relaxing and chatting. This time though there was a surly young man working the bar who had music blasting. He seemed annoyed by the presence of hotel guests and barked at us when we went to redeem the drink coupon that it was only good for the house drink (we already knew that since it was printed on the coupon). We were fine with that and the drink was a mimosa. We didn't stay long due to his attitude and the loud music. We went down to the lower level of the deck and the music could not be heard as much there. We noticed other guests clustered in that area. Normally everyone crowds to the top roofdeck area from previous stops by we saw, so I assume they were bothered by the music like we were. Internet service is available for free. They have a few computers you can use. . You can also go wireless and use your own laptop with a password they issue you (expires every 24 hours), but only in the public areas like the lounge. It will not work in guest rooms. There was an issue with this though. The passwords for the internet are printed at the front desk and can only be viewed through the print out. The printer broke while we were there so we were unable to get a second password after the first one expired so we could not get access through our laptop. The hotel is located in one of the better areas of the city, near The Spanish Steps. There were numerous shops (many high-end like Tiffany, Chanel, Armani, etc.) and restaurants around. Desk clerk made a restaurant recommendation one evening for a nice little place called Op La just a few blocks away. Food was pretty good, but it was pricey for what you got. It was also funny because nearly all the diners in the restaurant were also staying at our hotel as we recognized them. I would guess that the desk clerk is getting a nice kick-back. We actually had a better meal at a nice place called Ristorante Alla Rampa, closer to The Spanish Steps. Hotel arranged an airport transfer for us in a private car which was there promptly. Cost was about 60 Euro. Overall this was a very nice property and based on the prices in Rome and current exchange rates was worth the price. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittywake
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in one of the top floor rooms with a balcony and really enjoyed our stay. The room was huge and one of the biggest rooms I have stayed in in a hotel. The facilities were all of a very high standard but I would have liked wifi internet access. I liked the range of teas that they offered in the room and the designer Alessi kettle. There are computers downstairs but I wanted to use my own! Staff were very helpful and friendly, the minibar prices we thought were very reasonable, we loved having our own balcony and the hotel is very conveniently situated. I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location ,good hotel and fab roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: HexhamHappybunny
Reviews.Content: Good location for shops and sights! Although the rooms aren't particularly large ( at least room 318 wasn't) they are very pleasant, comfortable and spotlessly clean. Very quiet too, if you get a room facing onto Via dei Greci. Loved the roof terrace and the greenery. Loved the breakfasts too. Would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roxeyhart
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a weekend in Rome staying at the Mozart Hotel. I read loads of reviews on the hotels in central Rome before booking. None really appealed to me. Out of pure desperation I picked the Mozart. What a good choice. It was really well situated and looked at though it had been recently refurbished. We had quite a small but perfectly adequate double room and bathroom which offered a complete range of free toiletries. The room was fully air conditioned and had a lovely wide screen TV. Continental breakfast was very nice and the hotel had a lovely roof top bar and sundeck. Overall we were delighted with the choice. The Spanish Steps are about 5 minutes walk - Trevi Fountain 10 minutes and Piazza Novena 20 minutes. The Metro and Train stations are 5 minutes walk across the Piazza Polono. You can also pick up the local Trams from there. We caught a taxi from the airport directly to the hotel which cost us 40 Euros, this being a standard charge, but we could have quite easily have caught the train from the airport directly to our hotel for approximately 5 euros. The Vatican City is only two stops by Metro from the Hotel and it is also very easy to get the Metro to the Coliseum. We would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again in the future. A bit of advice:- Watch out for the Roman Guards outside the Coliseum, they charged us 20 euros (£14) to take a photo with them, with our own camera. Also, don't keep buying bottled water, there are natural springs all over Rome and you can fill up an empty bottle constantly - we were assured by the guide that the water is perfectly save.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location we loved it”
Reviews.Author: PhilCambridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mozart as a surprise birthday present. First impression is a small entrance along a side street at one end of the Via del Corso. This is a Gem as it is within walking distance of all the main tourist attractions in Rome. The hotel offers a pick up service from the airport for a little more than the going rate but the driver will meet you in the arrivals area of the airport and take you to the hotel door. Rooms are very clean with all the facilities you would expect. The lift is a bit odd as lift 1 only goes to floor 3 and lift 2 goes upto the top. Buffet breakfast is included and there is a very good choice. No resturant but there is a roof bar open in the summer months which is open from 5:30 till midnight. the staff are very friendly and can arrange trips or offer good advice on where to eat if you do not want the usual tourist offerings. I can offer a good tip and that is if you intend to visit the colleseum and do not want to queue for hours, visit the Palationo first and get a ticket for both. Spend some time soaking up the Palatino and then go to the Colleseum. Take the left queue entry for group entry and walk straight to the entry machine and put your ticket in. The right hand queue is for the ticket office and can take hours. Also the cleanest public toilets we found in Rome were in St Peters square to the right side as you face St Peters We will be visiting again very very soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: madsicilianEssex
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly staff that are more than happy to help. Stayed in vivaldi suite and hotel itself, both rooms of which were clean, tidy and air conditioned. Roof terrace and bar was lovely, buffet breakfast had a well stocked variety. Hotel is in a great position to get to all attractions, all shops and all restaurants. Would reccomend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: nebraskavacationgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mozart for two days in June 2007. I loved our room we had our own little balcony (see attached photo). The room was really nice and close to the Metro (5 minute walk). There was a computer that all of the guests could use free of charge and check email. A nice breakfast which was included in the room rate was provided. Also we were given complimentary drink tickets for the roof top terrace. We sat out there one evening it was very quaint and relaxing. Their staff did a good job on responding to emails when confirming our reservation before we left the States. It was a great experience and I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - A bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: JOD1501
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel room - we stayed in the Vivaldi Suites just around the corner from the Hotel. Our suite was massive, although overlooked the main road so was a bit noisy. Breakfast was delivered to the room at a specified time of the guest - and an adequate choice of food was available. Unfortunately our suite backed on to the kitchen so it was noisy in the mornings too! We could not fault the suite facilities and size (although there are no lifts available, so be prepared to lug those suitcases up the stairs in the Vivaldi Suites!), the location is excellent for sight seeing and the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotia01
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed 3 nights at the beginning of our trip to Italy and 2 nights at the end at this lovely hotel. We stayed in the Vivaldi Luxury Suites, which is around the corner from the main hotel, in a separate building. We liked this, as it felt like we were staying in our own apartment. The room had a king size bed, with two single beds for the kids. The plasma TV, and laptop with internet access were big hits with the kids. The bathroom was very nice, with a separate shower. The staff were professional and friendly, and we enjoyed their restaurant recommendations of Opla and Ristorante Edy. We enjoyed drinks on the rooftop bar a couple of evenings. Breakfast was included, and was more than adequate. The kids loved the hot chocolate - super rich and creamy. We enjoyed the location, and it was easy walking to the Pantheon, Campo de Fiori, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. We took the side streets to stay away from the the crowds, and to discover little shops . We would definitely stay at this hotel with our family again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location hectic”
Reviews.Author: fedekat
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, some rooms are better than others. We started in a large room and they moved us (one of my pet peeves when staying in a hotel!! I think if a hotel makes you change rooms you should get a discout or something!!) . The second room was SMALL, but the bathroom was a ncie size and that made up for it. Great service from all the staff!! The breakfast is very good, above average. Enjoy the rooftop garden. We got great resturaunt reccomendations from them. Follow their advice! My only complaint is the location, it is in the middle of the total mob scene tourist chaos of Rome, I would stay somewhere a little more off the beaten track next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Rome- Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: DC_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart was great. The room was very large and clean. (I am picky about my hotel rooms) The bathroom was immaculately clean and modern. Decorated with mosaic tile. The Jacuzzi tub was separate from the shower. The shower had very good water pressure. Though, it would be a little tight to shave your legs in the shower. However, the shower door closed well, so water didn't leak out. We have had shower door issues in other European hotels. The three best things about the hotel: 1) In the Vivaldi rooms breakfast is delivered to your room every morning. Great selection of fresh food. 2) A laptop computer in the room to check your email. 3) Great location. It is next to a music school. So, if you sleep past 11 AM or so, you might hear some live classical music. But, the room was totally quite otherwise. Especially considering it was near a main street. We also used the laundry service and hotel pick-up which were very good.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: apage626
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mozart after a friend recommended it to us. What a find! This place is adorable. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom big and comfortable. The housekeeping service was great. The breakfast was the best we've seen at a european hotel. Best of all, the location was perfect...right off the via corzo and by the Spanish Steps. Note that the street that hotel is on is not big enough for a car so they have to drop you off on the via corzo or on the other street that is perpendicular to the street where the hotel is. All in all this was a great experience. We would definitely stay here again. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “A Roman gem”
Reviews.Author: tejo42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mozart for 5 nights in May, 2006. Roman hotels are no "bargain" at that time of year - but the Mozart was worth just about every Euro. The standard room was spacious with a king bed, two night tables and more than adequate closet space. The bathroom was one of the largest we've seen in Europe - with excellent lighting and a substantial stall shower. The breakfast room is large and airy. The breakfasts themselves can be a bit repetitive, unless like the German style. However, it's more than adequate. Staff is extremely courteous and helpful. The folks at the desk speak excellent English and (apparently) good German. They don't expect you to speak Italian, even if you speak well. There's a pleasant rooftop deck with a bar where one can see the rooftops of Rome. Location is terrific - a short walk to the Piazza d'Espana (closest metropolitana) and Piazza del Popolo. The train station requires only a short cab ride. The Via del Corso becomes a pedestrian street for the evening passegiatta. A nearby restaurant, Opla, is very good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimmielou01
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hotel Mozart for holiday. We booked an upgraded room with a private terrace which was very nice. Good location near the Spanish Steps. The room was very clean and quite roomy. Our only hesitation is that the staff were less friendly than what we'd experienced elsewhere in Italy - (somewhat inpatient, sarcastic and not willing to answer questions). Other than that, we were quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: 4Blitz
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults, 10 year old & 6 year old) stayed at the Vivaldi Luxury Suites over Christmas from Dec. 19-27, 2006. Before our trip, we were a bit concerned about being away for Christmas for the first time with kids and staying in a hotel. I knew from experience that hotels in Europe are usually quite small and not what we are used to in Canada or US. Everyone told us we were nuts for taking the kids there because you don't find the same things you would at a Marriott or Four Seasons - with kids' clubs, gamesrooms, etc. Boy were we fabulously surprised!!!! This place was nicer and more comfortable than home!! The staff really went out of their way to make our Christmas away from home memorable. They offered to make reservations for us for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day because many restaurants were closed for the holidays. They made sure to send us to a nice enough restaurant, but one that also was family friendly. The suite (room 612) was very large, one king size bed, one day bed and one decent size cot. All very comfortable with nice linens. The bathroom was to die for!! Better than any master bath I've seen in some posh homes!! Robes, slippers, wonderful bath products. There was a nice sized desk with a laptop computer with free internet access 24/7. The huge plasma satellite TV across from the bed was my husband's favorite feature. The breakfast served every morning was enough to feed a family of 10. On Christmas morning, the breakfast was even more lavish than usual and the woman who served it to the room had included candies and chocolates for the kids. You cannot find a better location. It is right on the main shopping street, with the Trevi Fountain, The Spanish Steps, and all major tourist attractions about 5-10 minutes away. There was a small grocery store across the street, down a small alley way that we went to some nights to get quick snacks and drinks for the kids. The Turkish Bath (steam room) was down the hall from our room and my husband loved it. Everything in the place was pristine. We've been to many upscale hotels in Europe, Mexico, Caribbean, Canada and US and the Vivaldi Suites was right up there - maybe my favorite. I cannot think of one bad thing to say about it. Honestly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: noonbars
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with an extended family group of 8. It is in a great location for the Spanish Steps and easy walking distance to many other attractions. The breakfast buffet was good, with plenty of "European" choices. The coffee was great. My inlaws needed a change in rooms due to noise and they were quickly accomodated. The front desk staff was so-so depending upon the time of day. Most staff were helpful. The rooms were good size by European standards and the housekeeping staff was efficient. Only downside is the hospital across the street. Occasional late night ambulance. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSam
Reviews.Content: We were treated extremely bad in this Hotel. The rooms are so small and the staff was non helpful and very rude. There are so many boutique Hotels in Rome in the same neighborhood. I can excuse the small rooms, but not the ugly service we got. Go elsewhere. I don't pay money to be treated this way.

Reviews.Title: “met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: lisawalshy
Reviews.Content: stayed in the vitorio apartment. totally met our expectations. see my review under the forum section. great location...little small for family of four, but well appointed and the hotel staff were great

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: young_professional
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Vivaldi Luxury Rooms for 3 nights at the end of January. The room was excellent and the location is unbelievable... right on via del Corso (across the street from the big Nike store). Because the rooms are away from the street you can still get a peaceful night sleep. Breakfast delivered to your room every morning free of charge, jacuzzi bath, use of a sauna (good in the winter), free internet and Sky TV (if you wanna chill in the room for a bit!). We paid £95 a night which was very reasonable considering the quality of the stay. Would definitely recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: prettyparticular
Reviews.Content: Rome is not an easy place to find a decent place to stay especially with a couple of small children, rooms can be small and grubby and marketing materials imaginative or fundamentally dishonest depending on your point of view of such matters. My wife and I and our two boys ages 9 and 7 recently stayed in apartment 29 - a suite and it was just terrific, well located near the Spanish Steps, very spacious and impeccably clean. The service staff (including a porter) were very helpful, the breakfast (included) excellent and at 170 Euro per night very good value. We hope to be in Rome again one day and should that be so then we will certainly be calling the Hotel Mozart to book a room/apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mozart”
Reviews.Author: artydim
Reviews.Content: Went to the Hotel Mozart with a couple of friends and stayed in a superior room. The room while simple, had some lovely features and so was quite pretty. The batroom was very large with both bath tub and separate shower. Staff: veyr polite and held our luggage when we came back a week later so we could go sight seeing. Breakfast: the best I have ever had at a hotel, fantastic! many choices and beautiful room. Very good value for money, and nicer than any of us expected. Pretty enough to go for a romantic getaway without breaking the bank. The veranda has lovely views also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathy0516
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our room and stay at the Hotel Mozart. Very nice location, you can walk to all the sites very easily, it is a very lively area during the day because of all the shops but at night nice and quiet for sleeping. You are within minutes of the Spanish Steps. The staff is friendly and efficient, free internet service, 5 computers to use. Pleasant breakfast room, good selection of items to choose from. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others as we really enjoyed our stay and we loved ROMA.

Reviews.Title: “great location nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel23
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is has a very nice location just 3 minute walk to popolo and spanich steps. The room was clean but a little small but if you are looking for a just sleeping place its a very nice choise other wise its not good as there is not much place in the room to fell comfortable, the toilette was very big according to the room :) . The reseption service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love?”
Reviews.Author: Brackling
Reviews.Content: This is a good, high-end, three star hotel in a great location. We (a married couple from Toronto, Canada in our early 50s) stayed in the main hotel (not the Vivaldi Suites) in October. Nothing but praise. The room was very clean and well appointed, though small by North American standards -- but we weren't in North America, were we? Had we wanted a large room, we could have stayed somewhere else at close to double the cost. The breakfast (included in the price of the room) was a real plus and its value shouldn't be underestimated. Staff was friendly, helpful and professional. And to those of you who in past reviews have criticized the person staffing the roof-top bar, she has a name (it's Rosanna, as you would have found out had you bothered to ask). She is very personable, though a tad shy since her English probably isn't as good as she would like. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mozart's Vivaldi Suites-Terrific !”
Reviews.Author: ellac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mozart's Vivaldi Suites for 3 nights this past September, 2 couples traveling together. We were pleased with the hotel, the service and especially the Vivaldi Suites. Large bedroom, clean, comfortable bed, free internet (a plus) excellent air conditioning that cooled the area and not alot of street noise. Our room did not face Via del Corso (a bustling street) The bathroom was also large and obviously new. It had beautiful tile, good water pressure and a separate shower and tub. Heavenly after a full day of walking and exploring Rome. The location is excellent. It felt as though we were living in an apt. The breakfast was delivered to the room within a short time of ordering it. Just be aware that the rooms are approximately 3 flights up and there is no working lift, as far as I could see. However, It provided excellent exercise to burn off all of the fantastic food! We had no problem with the staff, they were polite and helpful, and punctual at the 4am time of departure. When we return to Rome, this is where we will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true”
Reviews.Author: Tuscanqueen
Reviews.Content: I don't know how anyone can talk badly about this hotel. We were overjoyed by our room, it was beautiful, clean, and had a balcony with table, chairs, umbrella and lemon trees and a fabulous bathroom with an awsome shower/bath tub and a surprise 2nd balcony with veiws of the church above the Spanish steps. Service was professional, not gushing. Very dependable and knowlegeable. I am a real person, this was not written by the hotel!! Breakfast is tasty, call ahead to reserve a table by the window. Great location, make sure to visit the Piazza de Poppollo nearby. Dine at Otella alla Concordia. Eggplant dish surperb! Service with a big smile!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the Vivaldi Luxury apartments”
Reviews.Author: Stef_Noble
Reviews.Content: The Vivaldi apartments are separate from the Hotel Mozart, so there is a short walk between them. This came as a bit of a pain when we needed something from Reception, but other than that, it was no big inconvienience. The rooms themselves were very nice. They has a modern bathroom with a jacuzzi bath and a separate shower ( I needed those Jacuzzi Jets after a day walking around Rome!). The main room had aircon, laptop with free internet access (we found it was useful to book our tickets for venues online and then nip out and collect them) and a lovely big flatscreen TV. As it is purely apartments, you dont have to trapse over to the hotel every morning for breakfast, they bring it to your room at whatever time you choose. We were there for the final 4 nights of our honeymoon and needed a good base to explore Rome from. The location is very handy, it is down one of the main shopping streets in Rome and is not far from all the designer stores near the Spanish steps. It is not near the Roman ruins, they are about a half hour walk away. Nevertheless everything is reasonably close. As you are part of the mozart hotel complex, you have access as a guest to the roof bar (on top of the hotel) that serves drinks until midnight. A very pleasant way to finish the day. As there are only stairs to the apartments, I would not recommend the apartments for those who need to use a wheelchair, pram or have difficulty climbing stairs (only one flight though).

Reviews.Title: “Warning to those considering this hotel”
Reviews.Author: debosolo
Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay Here. I have never reviewed a property online but that's mainly because I've never had such a horrible experience. My husband and I stayed here for two nights in October after a trip to the Amalfi Coast. I'm not sure which was worse, the surly staff (including the rude bellman) or the filthy room. We have traveled to Europe multiple times and since the Mozart was charging us $275 Euros for a "superior" room I expected something spartan but clean. Not so. The room stank like cigarettes - as if no one had aired it out in centuries. It was filthy - there was a thick layer of dust on the bedside table, along with several strands of hair. And the staff was unhelpful. We asked to move that first day but were told there was nothing comparable available for the first night. The surly desk seargant told me we could move to another superior room the next day. In the morning, I asked to be moved but was told by a different surly receptionist that there was nothing available. The only thing available was a suite at the "luxury" Vivaldi Suites across the hotel. Aha, I thought. This would be great. A better room at the same price. I could barely keep up with the bellman as he sprinted around the corner to show me the room. It was horrid. There was a dirty ashtray in the middle of the bed with cigarette butts, it stank to high heaven and it was darker than night, even though it was 8 a.m. We did not move. We could not find other accommodations because everything was booked. We left the windows open and hoped that the room would smell better after airing out for a day and being cleaned. Not so. It smelled horrible that evening and the hairs were still on the bedside table, along with the dust. We have just returned home and ALL of our clothes smell like cigarettes. I have stayed in many European cities and am used to smokers, but I find it inconceivable that a hotel would let its rooms stink so badly and that it wouldn't employ maids to sweep dust off one of the TWO tables in the room. It's not like it was a suite with lots to do... DO NOT STAY HERE. There are plenty of hotels of comparable price in just as good a location that are much nicer. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: smh888
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel (Vivaldi Suites) for 3 nights during our honeymoon. The room was very large, soundproof and included a huge jacuzzi tub. The staff are warm and friendly. Great location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable & Well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpkipper
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay here. Rooms were clean & comfortable bed excellent. Continental breakfast really nice, coffee super. Roof terrace great for a beer at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: travelmom28
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 2 teenagers at the Hotel Mozart this summer and our stay was wonderful in room 502. The room was very large. We had a private terrace which overlooked the rooftops of Rome. The bathroom was immaculate and the water pressure in the shower was very strong. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful. The hotel was central to all of Rome's attractions. The front desk staff was overly helpful with restaurant suggestions and plentiful with maps, directions, and tour information. I was a single mother on this trip and felt safe and comfortable. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Mahwah NJ must have stayed at a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: motherto3
Reviews.Content: Just reading the latest reviews and thinking of our trip last July 2005. We found the Vivaldi Suites @ Hotel Mozarat one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at. The breakfast was so plentiful we saved some of the cheese and meats for a snack later in the day. It was wonderfully clean and well appointed. It was centrally located to all the sites. The internet access was a delightful surprise as it made possible our communication with family. I would NOT hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vivaldi Suites”
Reviews.Author: jessjim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mozart Vivaldi Suites from July20-23rd. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by staff who brought our luggage up to our suite. The suite was immaculate and provided all the needed amenities. Our breakfast arrived on time, hot and the order was as requested . The Hotel staff gave us excellent referrals to local restaurants. We also went on tours of the Vatican and Collesseum with Angel Tours a great tour company . Thank You trip advisor members for your insight and great recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, overall”
Reviews.Author: drdkc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mozart on August 11th, as we were in Rome after a cruise, on a flight home the next day. We were with our children, ages 16 and 14. We were given a superior quadruple family room. The room was very spacious, the marble bathroom was large, clean and well lit, separate shower and tub.The hotel provided free internet to our teenagers delight. The breakfast was varied and top quality. There were assorted breads, croissants, meat, cheeses, cereals, eggs, and of course coffee, tea and juices. I don't understand the other review about the terrible breakfast. There is a lovely rooftop terrace, which is a bar after 5 pm, and during the day, a lovely place to sit and enjoy the view of the borghese gardens. The staff was pleasant, and the evening consierge recommended a local restaurant, Edys for our dinner. The lasagne was good, but all in all not the best for the euro. We had a room facing the Via del Corso, and it was noisy at night, despite the tight locking double paned windows. The noise did die down after midnight. We were on the second floor, so I don't know how it would be higher up. Over all, this was a hotel with good value, an excellent location, and helpful staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming”
Reviews.Author: RDiane
Reviews.Content: Last October 2005, two women and I visited Rome and stayed at the Hotel Mozart. I took a great deal of time selecting our hotel. I wanted a place with personality and charm and not a cookie cutter commercial room. Hotel Mozart was loaded with charm and everything I had imagined. So much so, that this October 2006, I will again be staying at the Mozart. The hotel stay included a welcoming drink on their rooftop terrace, and a generous help yourself varied breakfast. Mozart is situated down a narrow side cobblestone street. It's a few doors from the Via de Corso, (Rome's trendy shopping area) which closes to cars in the evening for pedestrian traffic. We saw all the normal wonderful sites and did so by walking. So the Mozart is in a perfect location. For the experience, we chose to take the bus from the airport to the hotel. We wanted to see what life was like for the local Italians. This trip involved two buses at 1 euro each bus, as compared to the return car ride back to the airport at 65 euros. The first day the three of us (one 35 y.o. and two 60 y.o.) walked to the colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. Day two St. Peter's Basilica and the Vatican Museum. The Pope can be seen (if he's in town) on Sunday at noon, or Wednesday mornings at 10 (if it's real hot) or normally at 11 o'clock. We did eat at Edy's (recommended in a Trip Advisor review) one night and found it very disappointing. The second night the hotel recommended a restaurant close by (can't remember the name) which has a wall with three shelves full of antipasto, in which you can help yourself or order from a menu. The staff here was wonderful as was the food. The pizza is to die for - very different from what we call pizza, as is the gelatto. One last tidbit, the restaurants charge a 2.50 euro per diner for bread whether you eat/order it or not. It's kind of like tipping - which should be no more than 10%.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Hotel Mozart”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 travled thoughout much of Italy during June and we stayed in the Hotel Mozart in late June. We had 3 rooms, with us parents staying in a nice double (with a completely separate shower), and our 5 kids split between a triple and a double. The air conditioning worked very well, despite the very hot conditions then in Rome. The staff is fantastic and specifically recommended excellent, yet reasonably priced, restaurants. The hotel is near the Via del Corso and only a few blocks from the Spanish Steps. The hotel has free internet access on 3 terminals. We enjoyed the rooftop bar in the evenings (giving our kids a small break from us)! Finally, we enjoyed walking up to the Villa Borghese in the mornings for exercise (again without kids) and then catching the bus to get to the sights therafter.

Reviews.Title: “What a Nightmare !!! - From very seasoned travelers.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was filthy with a very bad mold problem in the tiny bathroom which was definitly visible in all the grouting of the shower stall and on the walls and permiated through the whole room. (very small - approx 9' x 10'). The bedspread was so stained and disgusting that we used a shoe horn to remove it from the bed. The pillows were as thick as few dish towels put together. We immediatly asked if there were any other rooms available and were told no. We asked to have the room cleaned and the bedspread replaced and we were ignored. We had to get out of there, not only for some fresh air but were hungry and figured that would give them some time to clean. Nothing was done and the personel were very uncaring. Needless to say, we did not sleep well at all!! We are a well traveled family and have been to Europe many times as well as the UK, Canada, and various tropical islands etc..etc.. We expect to see very small rooms since the history of most buildings in Italy, France, Ireland or wherever add to the charm and site-seeing shold be your main agenda anyway. What is revolting about this property is the lack of cleanliness, the snobbish disregard for customer service and a breakfast that was a bowl of canned pineapple, coffee and bread. What a buffet !! By all means - skip the Hotel Mozart completely. Other reviews talk about location, location, location but given the hundreds of other opportunites of places to stay in the Eternal City - Look Elsewhere. We traveled throughtout five regions of Italy during 2 weeks. Venezia, Firenza, Tuscany, Positano and Rome. All our hotels were within 220.00 and 250.00 euros. All our accommidations (which were rated 4 stars), except for the Mozart, were really wonderful so it is very possible if you have the right planning, to have spacious rooms, friendly personnel, and a terrific breakfast to start your daily experience. Paying more money doesn't necessarily mean the best experience and staying within your budget and listening to friends who have Been There can be suprisingly rewarding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vixie83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for the last few days of our honeymoon. Although we didn't have the honeymoon suite we had a good sized room and bathroom with shower (no tub) and a basket of fruit and sparkling wine. Nicely decorated and the continental breakfast buffet in the morning was very good, egg, bread, cakes, pastries, cheese, ham, salami, fruit etc The hotel is in an excellent location just off one of the main roads down a side street. Excellent if you are doing clothes shopping as the street is lined with loads of different shops. Located within easy reach of most of the main attractions and if you don't have a problem walking then it is the best way to get around. Spanish steps and the Trevi Fountain are very near and slight further to walk to St Peters and the Collosseum. I would advise getting up very early if you don't like queuing as by lunch time there is often an hour or more to wait to get into the main attractions! Not always so great when its a scorcher outside! But there are plenty of refreshment facilities nearby to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Does not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: nobster666
Reviews.Content: This is a small intimate hotel that has a warm atmosphere to it. The staff are friendly and helpful, recommending excellent restaurants in the area. The rooms are lovely, done out in a stylish way. It is well located for all sightseeing and made the whole stay worthwhile. The roof top bar is a highlight. Perfect way to chill at the end of the day. Be warned, the road the hotel is on backs onto the main designer label shops. I managed to take my wife the long way around and avoid them for a few days but she eventually dragged me screaming to them.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Hotel, an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Sketchdnky
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a wonderful find! I booked the Hotel Mozart after reading all of the wonderful reviews here on TripAdvisor. After reaching Rome via Train from Milan my new wife and I took the Metro from Termnini to the Spanish Steps Station. Quick and easy even with hauling two large suitcases. The Hotel was just three or so short blocks from the Metro station (with a great Pizza place right outside of the entrance on the Metro... Soo good!). Just the walk from the Metro to the Hotel was great. Walking down old cobblestone streets with outdoor cafe's and high-end shopping stores was beautiful. The Hotel entrence itself is located down a little side street. A very nice lobby, with very friendly staff brought us right up to our room. We had a large room in the front looking over the street below. Two big windows with woden shutters opened up to the sights and sounds below. The noise was not a problem as we are city people, however, I must note that there is a Hospital right across the street. You will hear Ambulance sirens. This could be disterbing to people who are light sleepers. This was not a problem for us, and we laughed at the uniqueness of the sirens. Our room was big, beautiful, and comfertable. The Bathroom was all marble, spotless, and big! The large plasma TV was great, and the free internet lounge downstairs was always empty (Three terminals, plus printer). The breakfast was the normal fare, some breads, some jams, some meats. Though we really are not breakfast people we stopped by to see what they offered. The rooftop bar was beautiful, as we had a welcome cocktail before we headed out to dinner! My wife and I spent three wonderful nights of our Honeymoon at this hotel and would love to return someday! The Hotel was beautiful, the service excellent, and the location cannot be beat! It is within walking distance of almost everything. And if you deceide to take the metro instead of walking, it is three or so blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, experience.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vivaldi luxury rooms in May 06. Location was perfect with an easy walk to the Coliseum and Forum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navone and the Vatican. The room was wonderful. It was pricier than our other hotels in Europe but it was at the end of our trip and it was well worth it. By this time, we were tired and wanted a room that was really comfortable as we knew we'd spend more time in it. The plasma TV offered only one channel with English but it ran movies which we enjoyed when we needed some downtime. It was great to check out sports scores, etc., on the laptop provided in the room; we had no problems with the internet. The bathroom was large and nicely equipped with a very clean jacuzzi tub and a shower stall. We loved the setup for entrance to the rooms which made us feel as though we were staying in an apartment. Breakfast was bountiful and served promptly; service overall was excellent. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ralphjorlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mozart from May 13 to May 16 and had a wonderful stay. I would rate the hotel as the best of the 3 star and into a 4 star. We were in Room 410 and had a Balcony overlooking other buildings and Roofs - not a great view but very quiet and private and worth the additional money. The Balcony was important to us. We could have breakfast or just relax in the sun in private. The room was large enough and the bed was comfortable. The room included a flat screen TV. The use of the internet in the main hotel living room was a nice extra. The Hotel staff was very helpfull and pleasant.The breakfast was adequate but not anthing to get excited about. Don't try to drive down Via del greci. It is one way toward Via Del Corso and you can not enter or Drive on Via Del Corso. You have to back all the way up the street- I did it ( not a very easy venture, especially when you have 4 to 5 Italians telling you which way to go). Great location and you can walk to many of the nearby sites or easily get a taxi at the corner.Do not eat at the Dolce Vita Restaurant on the Piazza Navona- one of the worst meals we have ever had. Overall, I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camroc
Reviews.Content: On the basis of previous reviews I would not have picked this hotel for our wedding anniversary! However, we discussed the previous reviews and took a chance. From arrival to departure the Mozart was superb. FOH people, housekeeping, breakfast room people they were all excellent. We were in room 120, just off the communal lounge area, it had a balcony area. We brought the issue of noise, a radio, to the attention of FOH staff, as it happened, it (the noise and radio) disappeared! The very congenial Concierge gave us recommendations for restaurants nearby for dinner and they were singularly excellent. We will stay there again, we have previously stayed at the Valadier, another superb hotel, but we will try to go back to the Mozart. We were there on the 1st anniversary of the death of the late JPII, a very emotional and exciting time but we were not charged extortoniate rates for this w/e. Try the Mozart, be nice to them and they will respond favourably. We will be back. The location is excellent and the people are superb. Cormac and Maureen Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Lovely oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: redmagnolia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Vivaldi luxury suite 610 facing Via del Corso for 4 nights in Jan 06. It was a lovely suite, spacious and modern with luxury touches. Considering it is located in an unbeatable location in Rome, the price was fantastic - $180Euros incl. breakfast. - fantastic mosaic tiled bathroom, extremely clean and modern. But terrible shower head - limited hot water with temperature ranging from scalding to cold during shower times. - great plasma tv screen, but few English channels and free in-room laptop - good continental breakfast but lack of real toast was odd. I don't count packaged toast as real bread. - comfortable bed, a little noisy from the street. - great location in old residential building - front desk reception were pretty rude and indifferent but I guess thats not going to put off tourists to their hotel, as Hotel Mozart is still a rare find.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from the Vivaldi Luxury Rooms at the Hotel Mozart in Rome. We had a fantastic time there. It really is worth paying the extra money to stay in the Luxury Rooms ; little extras such as breakfast in your room, jacuzzi bath and 42" plasma TV (obviously a bit hit with the other half that one!). Also if you are travelling late at night, it is well worth paying the EUR65.00 for the hotel to collect you from the airport. Watched the hoardes of people queuing for the City Coach pickup which was heaving as it was Friday and was so glad that we had the comfort of the Mercedes to take us straight to our hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent. For shoppers like myself you really are stuck for choice. But also you can walk to all of the main tourist sites - Vatican, The Forum, The Colosseum etc. Also there are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. Will definitely be paying the Hotel Mozart a return visit. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jamesh764
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated close to the Spanish steps, and within walking distance of most other tourist attractions in Rome, the Hotel Mozart was superb. The staff were all friendly and helpful, with the exception of one bar-assistant on the roof-top bar, who made us feel as if we were an imposition. Our room was spacious, comfortable and well-equipped, with a large veranda. The breakfast room was a little crowded and the breakfast itself was not the best we've had, but perfectly adequate for a short-term stay. Free internet access in the lounge was a nice touch. We would happily recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: juttifrutti_uk
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this wonderful hotel and once again, it was truly memorable. The staff are friendly and helpful, the hotel is fantastic (we stayed in the Vivaldi luxury suites). An added feature is a laptop in the room so enables us to keep in touch with our friends back home. Would recommend this hotel for it's location and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Mozart for 4 nights and found the hotel excellent. The staff were very friendly and could not do enough to help you. The room was clean and had the relevant facilities expected - hair dryer, mini bar, tv etc. The location of the hotel was brilliant, within walking distance of everything and situated down a side street so at night it was not noisy at all. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Luxury Rooms are Great”
Reviews.Author: kaplanb1
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Vivaldi Luxury Rooms just after Christmas. They are completely fantastic! Large comfortable beds. Impeccably clean. Modernly furnished, and a great location! The in-room breakfast is fantastic, and the jacuzzi and turkish sauna are a great way to end a long day of sightseeing!! There's no reason to stay anywhere else in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but mixed feelings about whether it is worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: London_bird
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome having spent the second half of our honeymoon there. We booked the Vivaldi Suites on the basis of the Trip Advisor reviews so thanks everyone!! We have stayed in Rome before (on a tighter budget!) and our room at the Vivaldi Suites was miles better than the non-descript Best Western we stayed in before near Termini Station. As it was our honeymoon (and we were staying for 3 nights) we got a free upgrade to the Prestige Rooms which we understand are more spacious. The room was lovely, modern (with some traditional touches), clean and the bed very comfortable. We were not facing Via del Corso but an inner courtyard with absolutely no view. That was fine as we spent most of the day out anyway but the room was quite dark and as it was only on the first floor (2nd to the American readers) didn't get much natural light even with the shutters open. We had no issues with noise from outside or the corridor! Our bathroom was of an equally high standard - very clean, modern and uncluttered with a separate shower cubicle. The jacuzzi bathtub was very welcome after a hard days sightseeing! Like some other reviewers our laptop with free internet connection didn't work. I reported it to the hotel reception on the Saturday and got a rather disinterested reply suggesting nothing could be done about it until the Monday anyway. It was never fixed and I made the observation again when we checked out on the Tuesday. It wasn't a big deal as we were on honeymoon and glad to be away from things like that (my husband wanted to check the soccer scores!) but I commented to the reception that if they are trying to use that as a selling point for potential guests then they need to make sure it works properly. One of the things we liked about Vivaldi was that you really felt you had more privacy than in a regular hotel. It felt more 'real' and as you came in and out every day it felt like you were going into your own apartment just like the locals. Breakfast delivered to the room was a nice touch although we wouldn't rave about the standard - by day 3 we'd had enough of the predictable slices of cheese and ham and some very sweet sickly pastries. The location was unbeatable and although very busy on via del Corso, a more Roman experience than many other tourist hotels in the ugly areas around Termini Station. We walked absolutely everywhere including to the Vatican and the Colesseum. Forget the metro! Lots of good restaurants close by to satisfy every taste and budget. We found a couple of good modern type pizzerias on Piazza Augusto Imperatore (Gusto and Recafe) - probably not to everyone's taste but good value and not at all touristy. There is a supermarket just round the corner from Vivaldi on via Vittoria - forget using the mini bar, we stocked up on water, beer and soft drinks from there instead and as you have a kettle in your room you could get coffee and milk as well. If you are looking for somewhere more informal than a standard hotel and something a bit less chintzy and more modern we'd definitely recommened. Excellent standard of accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome............Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: rhirsig
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of Hotel Mozart's Vivaldi Luxury Rooms and it was hands down the best hotel on our Italy trip.
