You first check in at the Hotel Mozart and a bellman escorts you on a short walk about a block away from the Hotel down Via Del Corso (the city's chic and hip shopping street full of Rome's most fashionable stores) to a non-decsript street entrance into a building up several flights of stairs(the elevator was broken when we were there). Each floor has has only a few rooms with your own private housekeeper stationed there. The room was definately "Luxury" with a combination jacuzzi tub/jacuzzi shower, 42" plasma tv, oversized king bed, and a laptop computer with free high speed internet access. Breakfast is included in the price and delivered directly to your room minutes after you place the order. The room was very quiet as it faced an inner courtyard. The staff was excellent and helpful. We received several diffrent restaurant recommendations from the front desk to local places with great food at reasonable prices. Also included is a free drink on the rooftop bar which has a great view of Rome. The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of the city. You can walk to almost anywhere or jump on the subway at the Spanish Steps only a few blocks away. You probably will rather walk or even take a taxi(reasonably priced) since the subway can be very crowded. Book directly with the hotel online to get a price which can't be beat for what you get. I don't know why anyone would stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rome is amazing and this is a super place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sweenoid
Reviews.Content: we always believe that a hotel is a base to explore from and it's a bonus if we look forward to returning to our vacation base , the highlight here is the City of Rome and The Vivaldi suites are an ideal base to explore this magnificent City. It was our second stay this year but this time we took 2 rooms as we were accompanied by our children , the rooms are large , the bathrooms super , we don't use minibars but if you do it's good value , we don't watch TV but the 42" plasma TV does look very impressive!! , the room PC's were well received by the kids for e-mail and msn - personally I like to take a break from that on holiday!. The breakfast service in the room is SUPERB-fresh and tasty and far too much. We were there on a Bank Holiday and Rome was packed but we could not hear a pin drop in our room , besides our children next door of course! :-) Don't use transport in Rome if you are half-fit! WALK-the whole City is living history and we walked everywhere easily , when you get tired sit and admire the views , have a coffee or a long lunch-you can walk easily to the circus maximus in 40mins , the Vatican in 25minutes , Borgese gardens in 5 mins , etcetc Local restaurant recomendations Ill Brillo Parlente 5mins away on via dell fontanella , eaten there 4 times in 3 visits-SUPERB(Danish Beef dish for 2 is to die for as are the pastas and my kids thought their pizza's the best ever)it's packed every night all year with locals so pop in and book-upstairs belies the huge area downstairs. Lowenhaus on the same street is fun if you want a break from pasta and fancy a German Beer or 2. Near the Colloseum try Trattoria Nerone on Via del Termi di Tito an archetypal familty restaurant where all the family help out which can be fun when Grandma serves you!! Have the antipasto Abruzzese buffet , it's wonderful. In Trastevere try Pizzeria Popi Popi, great!or the Caseta De Trasteevere-cheap as chips but the food is great , service friendly and again full of locals` pre dinner for a glass or two of Italian wine visit Antica Vineria DiVia Della Croce 4minutes from Hotel or Gusto 2 minutes!-the 1st is our choice-superb atmosphere , treat yourself to a glass of Amarone if you can afford to or a Ruffina if on a budget or have a glass of each like us. We arranged a private Heart of Rome tour with Angels tours whih was very good but did the rest ourselves with a bit of research ,whatever you do spend all day in the forum/Colloseum/Victor Emanuel Monument area and soak up the history, the baths of Caracalla are a short walk away but highly recommended. Our recomendation is to arrange a taxi transfer arranged by the hotel on arrival(expensive granted but when 2 hrs delayed they were there to meet us)and take the metro and bus back which is incredibly cheap and balances the cost. Back to the hotel-our only use was to use the rooftop bar which is lovely with scented flowers but unfortunately this closed last day of Oct so we only had 1 night up there , I was a tad annoyed that on a balmy evening 1st Nov they would not open it for us. The one receptionist was very helpful the other singularly unhelpful -such is life. Overall the star here is the City of Rome and in our opinion overall the Vivaldi Luxury suites live up to their name , the location is second to none and although expensive is in our opinion worth it Have a good trip!

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Rooms Were Great”
Reviews.Author: smy
Reviews.Content: Overall my wife and I really enjoyed the Hotel Mozart's Vivaldi Suites. The bed was comfortable, the combination jacuzzi tub/jacuzzi shower was amazing after a long day of walking. The decor was very nice, flat-plasma television and a life-saving laptop for internet use was provided in the room free of charge. Breakfast was very prompt, about 10 minutes after calling down a very nice lady brings it to your room. It had a nice combination of foods to start the day. The staff was always very polite and the bellhop that carried our luggage down the street and up the stairs to the rooms wouldnt even accept a tip saying only "please, no, its my job." The rooms felt VERY safe as after night fall you had to go through three seperate locked doors to get there. First was the outside door off the street which you unlock with a normal key, then you go up the stairs where you have a combination key-code lock to enter a passcode, then you have a swipe-key to enter your room. The only thing that I didnt like was the rooms were not very "soundproof" as occassionally in the mornings you could hear the staff working outside your room, or the occassional conversation outside in the hallway. Nothing a pair of earplugs didnt remedy, however. I will offer one piece of advice, though. When in Italy, if you are in your room, be sure to put the "Do Not Disturb" (Non Disturbare) sign outside your door. If its not there, believe me, they assume you arent either and the maids will come right in. They walked in on my wife and I just after we had gotten back from a quick gelato run. Luckily we were fully clothed...LOL. Im not sure why it took the previous reviewer over 2 hours to get to the Vatican from here, though. It took my wife and I 20-30 minutes TOPS to get there. He must have gotten lost if it took that long. We walked everywhere from the hotel with no problems and always felt safe. The only time we took other transportation in Rome was to and from the Airport and Termini with our luggage. It takes about 3 minutes for a taxi to arrive if you ask the front desk to call one for you when you check out. I would definitely recommend the Vivaldi rooms to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi at Mozart was OK”
Reviews.Author: DERH50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vivaldi suites for 3 nights. The immediate impression was poor - entry is off street and grubby; the lift was broken so we had to carry the bags up the stairs. Our room was above average in size compared to similar priced hotels in cities such as Paris and London; it was clean but the vanity light in the bathroom was not working and the Jazuzzi would not hold its water. Breakfast is taken in your room, not the hotel, but it was delivered very efficiently. The Mini Bar is very well priced. We had a drink in the hotel bar on the rooftop and this was very relaxing although the noise of renovations at the Vivaldi area were intrusive in the morning. Visit Rome for history - it is not as impressive as Paris or London - the traffic is chaotic, the taxis unavailable and you end up walking a lot. It took us 2hrs 20 mins to get from the Corso to the Vatican by bus - take the metro, we returned in 10mins! The hotel is close to the best shopping in Rome from the top international names to more modest offering. There are plenty of places to eat in the area - walk towards the Spanish Steps off Corso. We enjoyed Como last year and will definately return soon; we are unlikely to return to Rome in the short term and would opt for Venice if we want a city break - but I believe there's a lot of water there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vivaldi Suites @ Hotel Mozart”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at the Hotel Mozart and then after reading some the good reviews of the Vivaldi Suites at the Hotel, we upgraded before we left for Rome. It was a super room. The bathrooms were beautiful ( spa tubs), beautiful breakfast served in your room everyday. We did not see the regular rooms at the hotel (Vivadi suites are down the street a bit), but I am sure they were nice. Also, there is a rooftop wine/coffee place that was a great spot to be in the evening. The location is perfect! We walked everywhere. We definetly would stay there again. 9/13-16/05.

Reviews.Title: “The computer is a mess”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a careful check on the day itself (explicit written confirmation) we arrived around midnight and found out that there were no rooms for the five of us (2 superior doubles and 1 single) because "the computer is a mess". The owner arranged for another hotel and provided a room for three. A very disappointing start! The hotel is ok, staff is ok, we think the hotel is overpriced. We wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Suites were very nice ... but”
Reviews.Author: skay448
Reviews.Content: We really liked our room and the room service at Vivaldi Suites. We over looked Via del Corso so it was very noisy in the morning, starting at 7am. The hotel concierge were somewhat helpful but not high service. We thought that entering the Suites off the street was cool, but that the hallway and stairs (elevator was broken) could use some real cleaning in order to improve appearances. Once you entered the Suites themselves they were fabulous. We did not love the location as we spent most of our time walking someplace else, i.e. Trevi, Forum, Vatican, Farnese, Campo de Fiore. I would like to stay someplace further south next time,i.e. Farnese or Campo de Fiore areas. We loved Rome - would go back but maybe not to Hotel Mozart.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: MicheleDinAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vivaldi Suites for four nights at the start of September. This was our favorite hotel of our 12-day 11-night trip through Italy. The Vivaldi Suites are away from the main hotel, a short walk down the street in an apartment/condo type building. They are entered via two large wood doors between a couple of shops. It was neat - like we lived there! The room was wonderful, wood floors in the bedroom, large plasma t.v., couch, desk w/laptop to the Internet (although couldn't check our email in the States - don't know why). The bathroom was beautiful, too - enclosed shower, jacuzzi bathtub, elegant fixtures (had trouble getting hot water a couple of times in the shower, though). It was nice & quiet with the windows and shutters closed, but it didn't have a balcony and just overlooked the street (which was better than our other hotels which overlooked walls :) The rooftop bar was nice, the breakfast tray was big & served in your room just a few minutes wait after calling (of course, our room was right next door to their kitchen). For a couple of mornings, I had to use my limited Italian since the room attendant did not speak English, but that was fun, and she was nice. British Airways had lost our luggage on the way there (Rome was our first stop). The front desk clerks were very nice & helpful. They helped us call the airline a couple of times. My husband received his bag after the second night, but I did not receive mine until we got home - it had been three weeks since I had seen it last! My advice - carry on all luggage!! Most of the salesclerks in the shops were VERY unfriendly to me - which was disappointing, since I could have used a smile as I was very sad at not having any of my clothes (luckily, I had all of my non-clothing personal items in my carry-on bag). Anyway, I think a good rule of thumb is what another tripadvisor said - don't buy the cheapest room in a hotel - go at least midway or live it up with the most expensive. This is what we did at Hotel Mozart, and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Breezey
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome yesterday and know how the Trip Advisor helped in making our decision to stay at this lovely hotel. We were there for 3 nights and stayed in the Vivaldi Suites. There are two levels of suites so ours did not have a balcony or couch which others had listed. However, what it did have was a gorgeous bathroom with all modern and high end amenities. a notebook computer with free internet access, a very comfortable king sized bed, and a large flat screen tv (2 english channels - one CNN the other a movie channel). The long windows opened into the internal courtyard so the room was very quiet and we didnt hear all the sounds of the Via Del Corso. The Vivaldi Suites are very close to the main hotel (literally a minute walk) which has a wonderful roof top garden where we had drinks before dinner each night (the first night drinks were on the house). Breakfast was delivered to the room about 10 minutes after the call and the tray is beautifully presented with fruit (never saw such a large peach in my life), hard boiled eggs, meats, cheeses, yogurt, and wonderful breads and cookies. You can ask for cereal and eliminate of course those items that you dont want. And dont forget the cappucino! The location of this hotel cannot be better. You are minutes to the Spanish Steps and very close to the Trevi Fountain and some wonderful restaurants. Suggest that if someone recommends the Porto di Riappeti do not go! Specializing in seafood (they say it is fresh) we were very disappointed in the food (flavorless to bad) and the service (dont let the owner fool you, he does a great sales job but once he is gone the waiter is very unfriendly). On the other hand had a great meal at the Brasserie de la buvette on Via Vittoria (a block or two from the hotel) and another at a hotel recommended restaurants on Via Riappeti. We tried the much touted San Crispino Gelati near the Trevi Fountain and were disappointed. Much richer than other gelati that we enjoyed and much preferred the offerings at the Gelateria Bar across the street from the Trevi Fountain. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Mozart when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: AmoItalia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times throughout the past 4 years. It is clean, well managed and reliable. I recommend the deluxe rooms with balconies. The Vivaldi suites are nice, but I prefer the deluxe rooms because of the locations and views. I have a feeling that the previous reviewer (from New York) had never been to Rome/Europe before. That "smell" is hundreds of years of history Sir! (Hate to see his review of anyplace in Venice!) I'm also a bit surprised by his service complaints. Again, don't expect The New York Four Seasons 5 star treatment from a 3 star hotel in Rome! Though I have never thought of the staff as overly friendly, I have never had a request that wasn't met, efficiently and respectfully. Though there are fancier hotel's in the city's center, for the price and location, this hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we expected.....”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during the end of our 2 1/2 week trip to Italy. Sadly, this was my least favorite out of the 5 hotels we stayed at on our trip. When we checked in the first night, we were given an extremely small room with a queen size bed. We had booked a room with two twin beds, but were told they had no more rooms (by the way, it's room number 310 - okay if you're travelling alone, or don't have a lot ot luggage). The gentleman working at the front desk was not very nice, and treated us like we should have been happy with the room we got. Luckily, the next day another gentleman was working at the front desk, and we were moved to another larger room with twin beds. The room was okay, but loud because of it's location (room number 304) which was right over Via del Corso street. It was definitely better than the first room. Good points about this hotel: location (near the Piazza di Spagna and the Piazza Del Popolo), good buffet breakfast, nice reading room, rooftop bar, and free internet service. Bad points: service was iffy (one front desk staff member was not helpful and condescending, the others were fine), room and bathroom were not that clean, rooms need to be updated. We based our decision to stay here from the reviews on this website. I've read more bad reviews lately, so I guess it's just the luck of the draw. Overall, I don't think I'd stay at this hotel again when I go back to Rome. Recommendations: *EDY restaurant about three blocks from the hotel (they can give you directions at the hotel) - great food and service (not touristy) *Ristorante Barberini - at Piazza Barberini (Via della Purificazoione 21) - wonderful, family-run restaurant - great food and service *Il Gelato Di San Crispino (Via della Panetteria 42 - near the Trevi Fountain) - fantastic gelato! *Get reservations on-line for the Galleria Borghese and the Colosseum at the SelectItaly.com website. It will save you from long waits in line. Definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Giannetta
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Rome. Hotel Mozart was the perfect place to stay for our family vacation. We had three different type rooms, classic, superior, and deluxe. All of the rooms were clean and well appointed. The bathrooms are all marble. Showers are small but the water was hot! The mini bar was well stocked. Breakfast was served in a delightful dining room. It consisted of a variety of meats, cheese, pastry, cold cereal, coffee, and juice. The sitting room was very nice and included a computer. The rooftop bar was a cozy retreat after a hard day of sight seeing. The staff was friendly and helpful. They called taxis, suggested restaurants, and made dinner reservations for us. I will be staying here the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: LizaGrape
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mozart in March 2005 for a week. On the whole the hotel has made a good impression: halls are nicely decorated, rooms are clean, staff is rather friendly. The only problem was: when we arrived our room wasn't ready yet (it was about 1 p.m) and we had to wait for 1,5 hour. As for location, via dei Greci is a very quiet street (especially in comparison with via del Corso) and it is not a "long dark alley" as someone has described it. If you wanna go shopping the location is great (all famous boutiques are situated in 5-10 minutes walking distance). But if you plan to go sightseeing a lot, maybe it's better to choose a hotel closer to Panteon and Pl. Venezia (it would be easier to get to Vatican, Trastevere and some other districts). Anyway Mozart is normal too: walking is very good for health and old Rome is really beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sue
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone, I booked 2 superior twin rooms in the hotel itself, for 4 adults, we stayed for 4 nights, got a great deal as we booked some months in advance. I emailed the hotel many times and my queries were always dealt with promptly. The hotel is in a great location, just off Via del corso and not down a dingy side street, because of the one way system if you are getting dropped off by a taxi, they come from the other side which is further down the street than coming from the Via del Corso side. What I liked: The rooms were beautiful and clean, tiled floor and full marble bathroom with bath and shower. Good buffet breakfast. Staff, polite and attentive and even rang a restaurant one night to make reservations and booked a taxi to bring us there etc. Rooftop bar. Great location, between Piazza del Popollo and the Spanish steps, a supermarket nearby and fruit stalls. Good restaurant about a 10 minute walk called Otello on Via del Croce about 3 blocks down from Via Del Greci where hotel is located. Free internet access. Suggestions/Room for improvement: I always like to give the good and well and the bad but it this case there were no bad points about the hotel, we had no complaints, the only thing I would suggest as a 'nice to have' is that after you check out and have an evening flight it would be nice if there was someplace to shower, some hotels have a courtesy room that you could use for this purpose but the hotel was booked so had no room available, if they had a shower in the avaiable bathroom downstairs it would be perfect. But to summarise: Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: epembroke
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We stayed in the Vivaldi Suites and our parents stayed at the hotel. Both rooms were just great. Clean, new, great bathrooms, internet in our room, flat screen TV's, great breakfasts. Our parents room (#506) was just awesome, two great patios overlooking Rome! Great location, in the middle of all the sights. The only bad aspect of Rome was the food, just boring and expensive. I would suggest getting out of the tourist area to eat. In the 3 weeks we were in Europe, this was the nicest hotel we stayed in-thanks Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: Canuk11
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel by using the reviews on this website. We were not disappointed at all. The Hotel is well run. The staff is friendly and helpful. We stayed in the Vittoria Suite which is a block away from the hotel. As a family of 5 we need more room than a regular hotel room can offer. The suite was clean, spacious and quiet. We had satelite TV, a lap top and a cel phone to use(it was even programmed with the managers home phone # ). We had a supermarket down the street. Breakfast served at the hotel was good. The staff helped us with local restaurant picks for supper that were always pretty good. We were 3 minutes from the Spanish Steps, 20 minutes from the Forum. We walked everywhere. Rome was great. The Hotel Mozart was great. A big thumbs up from the McKays'.

Reviews.Title: “Two night stay in Vivaldi suites was the best part of our visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: rachly
Reviews.Content: My family of four truly enjoyed our 2 night stay in Rome at the Mozart VIVALDI SUITES before we boarded a cruise ship. I have high expectations of a vacation and I believe that a good hotel can make ALL the difference during a vacation. Staying in the VIVALDI SUITES was the nicest part of our 2 day visit. The rooms were very clean, quiet and it was great to have the laptop and the plasma TV. My teenagers were fascinated! WHATEVER YOU DO IN ROME DO NOT TAKE THE 110 TRAMBUS! It was the biggest mistake, and ruined what should have been a memorable day in Rome, a horrible day in Rome! I only wish the front desk clerk would have discouraged us from going. Not only it is a rip-off, but you are fearful to get off the bus to see the sights, as there are long lines to re-board the bus in the horrifying July heat! I was very disappointed with the meals we had in Rome. I will not go back to Rome in the near future, however I would recommend the Mozart Vivaldi Suites to family and friends. I can't say anything about the main hotel (right off the reception area). I should also inform you that in order to get to one's room you must hike up a few flights of stairs. I did not mind, in fact I much prefer. I did see a small elevator, but it looked to me more like a service elevator. The breakfast tray that the nice housekeeper's bring to your room is a decent way to start your day. Personally though, I do not like to eat in the room, even after insisting to the front desk if we could have breakfast in the main b'fast area or the rooftop, they still did not let us. They have their little rules about the way they want to run things. Overall, our hotel stay exceeded our expectations. I truly did not know what to expect, as I got the hotel from a previous guest on cruisecritc.com, and then checked out all the good reviews from other guests on tripadvisor...Thank you to Drew who told me about the Mozart.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: mwhite4809
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent visit to Hotel Mozart. We booked 2 triple rooms as we were traveling with kids and grandparents and both rooms were large and nicely appointed. The mini bar was very well priced by hotel standards and the bathroom was large and well lit. It had the feel of a small boutique hotel with lots of charm and situated in a wonderful neighborhood. Breakfast offered enough choices to keep everyone satisfied and the breakfast room was always clean and well attended. We did enjoy the rooftop bar and loved watching the sunset in such a serene setting. There were also several computers available which was a pleasant surprise. Our daughter was able to catch up on email and my husband could check in with his office. All in all, we found the Hotel Mozart to be very good. We knew we were not staying in a 5 star hotel but this was a very satisfactory 3 star hotel, much better than some 4 star properties in other cities. It was a very good value for the money and I would definitely recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: JD1
Reviews.Content: Where to start - probably commenting on the latest review of Mozart! I am glad to see there is only one bad review, and I suppose every hotel has the occasional mishaps - the Mozart we stayed at really does look like a different place to the one in the review from N Carolina... We stayed at Mozart for four nights at the end of July, the first stage of our honeymoon. We were dropped off by our taxi about 15 metres from the front door of the hotel and were quickly met by the concierge who took my wife's case from her and into the hotel. Admittedly arriving in the dark, the hotel doesn't look great from outside - however once inside all is well. The staff were very nice and were keen to help. They recommended an excellent little restaurant - Op La - which was only three streets away and did some wonderful food. We stayed in room 506 on the fifth floor. We did have to get two lifts and walk a little to get there, but it was more than worth it. The bedroom was simple but very nice, with a great Plasma screen TV (Didn't really get watched, but looked the part!), mini bar and rather nice Alessi kettle. The air con was excellent and very very welcome relief from the city heat. The bathroom was a good size and had a jacuzzi and excellent shower. There was also a door off the bathroom onto a small terrace. The best bit about our room was the main roof terrace. Two sets of French doors opened onto this private balcony, which was well equipped with two sun loungers, table, chairs and a parasol. The terrace was a lovely way to relax late afternoon each day following a hard day touring the sites. This was finished off perfectly by the busking saxonphonist whose music drifted onto the terrace each afternoon. Breakfast was served in a nicely decorated room, and the offering was very good, with a good selection of bread, cheeses, meat, juices etc - a good standard all round. There was a small issue about the close proximity of the tables and there was a risk of sitting facing another couple, however this only happened to us once and the fact they did not speak English was a bonus as it meant we didn't have to speak to them! The roof terrace bar was excellent. We started each of our evenings here with a glass of Chianti, watching the sun setting over the church across the road. The lady working in the bar was very nice to us, and was always offering crisps/nuts etc with our drinks. Drinks were fairly reasonably prices for a hotel in the centre of a capital city. The position of Mozart is perfect - it is right on the Via Del Corso and is right in the middle of the main sites; the Vatican is a short walk one way and the Colosseum a shorter walk the other. The internet point in the lounge was also helpful, although it proved expensive for me as it told my wife when Tiffanys was open!! All in all the Mozart played a massive role in the first leg of our honeymoon being absolutely perfect, and we will certainly return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 weeks in Italy and enjoyed wonderful small hotels in five cities -until the Hotel Mozart in Rome. Even now, reading other folks' reviews, I wonder if it's the same hotel. Yes, it's conveniently located. Of course, getting there means dragging your luggage down a long dark alley to a non-descript, tiny side entrance off Via Del Corso. Our room was on the 5th floor. We weren't there 4 hours until the elevator went out and stayed out the entire time we were there - 3 days. After a long, hot day of walking in Rome, we dreaded going back to the hotel. Our room was dirty, dark and smelled consistently of sewer gas, especially the bathroom where we could barely breathe while dressing. We had to leave the windows open, which made for much noise, some bugs and was unsettling. The room safe was a loose box in the bottom of the closet. I suppose we could have used it, but then someone could have easily just carried the box off. We consistently reported these things to the staff who just looked at us, shrugging their shoulders. Breakfast was okay, but we couldn't sit at a table by ourselves. If you are couple - you will become a fourple at the crack of dawn and you likely won't be able to speak the same language as the person you're breaking bread with. (A lot of faux-pleasant toast buttering and nodding). The over-rated roof garden - again, a hike up the stairs - is very tiny with a bar. The bartender serves with about as much hospitality as the wicked witch of the west. And, oh yes, the complimentary drinks only include one glass of house wine - no substitutes. I read other traveler's reviews of this hotel with considerable wonder. The Mozart was nowhere near luxurious, not friendly, fraught with problems, uncomfortable and for the money, was the most inferior hotel we stayed at in all of Italy. Just can't recommend this one. Made me understand that where you stay can make all the difference in enjoying a city. At this point, the Mozart in Rome is on the very bottom of my list. Don't set your expectations to high if you are going there.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Suites are Absolutely perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTammy
Reviews.Content: I am actually writing this review from our Gorgeous Vivaldi Suite at the Hotel Mozart where we are about to spend our final night (of 4 nights) on the free internet access provided in our suite via laptop (also provided)! Eveything is top rate! Our room is huge and boasts a king size bed, 42 inch plasma tv, robes, slippers, jacuzzi tub plus separate shower. You name it and it is here. My husband and I have travelled a good bit, and I think this is the best place we have ever stayed...and they had quite large shoes to fill in that we had just finished a 5 star Seabourn Riviera Cruise. The Mozart made the transition from the luxury ship no let down at all! We have enjoyed a huge breakfast every morning. We visited London and Paris last year and paid over $100 more per night and received much less than the Mozart. There is nothing else we would ask for in a hotel...truly luxurious. Location wise, Via Del Corso is wonderful. There must be 20 restaurants within a 3 minute radius and 100 restaurants within 5 minutes. I mean they are everywhere and so are the great shops and gelato booths. The area is very safe but vibrant and is teeming with action! Today we timed it and it took 12 minutes to walk to Trevi Fountain. After enjoying the fountain area a while we walked another 15 minutes to the Coliseum. Great location. The only caveat I would offer is that there are 48 steps up to our room. This was not a problem for us at all but I just wanted to mention it in case someone with limited mobility reads this. If we are fortunate enough to return to Rome, we definitely intend to return to the Mozart Vivaldi Suites.

Reviews.Title: “OK, this skeptic is satisfied !”
Reviews.Author: snaggletooth
Reviews.Content: I am a skeptic by nature and if something looks too good to be true, it usually is. I booked our 6 night stay at the Vivaldi suites at the Mozart strictly based on the reviews here. They all looked so good and so many looked familiar I began to be convinced that they were all ( or at least a lot of them ) were written by somebody connected with the hotel and we would arrive to find a real dump that had been hyped by a hotel employee What can I say? It really was that good !!!!!! Believe the reviews First, I recommend getting the airport car pick up. It was a little more money, but it was worth it after a long and hot trip. A cab was about 50 Euro to/from the airport ( what some people we met on the rooftop bar told us ) and the car was 65 to pick us up and on the return to the airport it was 53 Check in was pretty easy. The porter was tied-up so our favorite guy at the Desk ( Cesidio ) sent us up to the rooftop bar for our welcome drink, and we decided to stay for a few more since the view at 6 PM was so nice. When we came down our bags had been delivered to our room. Later that night we met the conceriege at the restaurant he's recommended. Can't remember the name of that particular restaurant but the guy there was called Mr Georgio. It was a nice restaurant. I really enjoyed the fettucini with truffle sauce. GREAT ROOM !!!! We were in 610 which overlooked the via del corso. Really big ( and very clean ) bathroom. Actually it was bigger than most bathrooms in US hotels, and much nicer too. Great hardwood floors with a big plasma. The bed was nice and actually comfortable. AC made it as cold as you wanted. The best part was or course the laptop in the room. The internet connection was fast, like computer modem speed but about 10% slower. Still it was the fastest I saw in all of Italy. I even posted a few times on this forum, and when I had a question about left luggage at FCO I posted the question from my room right to TA forum and had an answer when we returned from dinner and drinks. Very nice to be able to have that feature. Breakfast was OK. The pastiries were hot. THe butter was cold and the juice was fresh and cold.the coffee was good too. I saw some people complain that it got boring after a few days. Ok go downstairs to the little snack bar, which has the exact type of coffee and pastries for 10 euro! We stayed out so late every night that we slept through two breakfasts ( or was it three ) The cute girl that delivered it was just as fast as I had read on this forum ...about 7 or 8 minutes from when we called. It's nice to have your food delivered to the breakfast table by the window, especially if you are too tired to venture out MY ONE COMPLAINT which has nothing to do with the Mozart ( it turns out that this was in all 4 hotels we stayed at in Italy....must be an Italian thing ) was no ironing board or iron in the room. Try landing in a city where you like to dress up at night, and have wrinkled clothes! Might I suggest taking a travel steamer to Italy. Still we were able to get stuff laundered or pressed ( for 5 euro which was pretty standard price ) Our maid did our clothes and had them same day. She was really great. I spent about 3 months on various forums looking at places to stay. While in Rome I had a chance to wander around and check out a few of the other hotels I had looked at. Basically, we'll stay at the Vivaldi suites for every other trip we take to Rome. They were really perfect, and awfully cheap considering the 10% discount we got for booking 5 or more nights. 5 minutes walk to Piazza del poppolo and spanish steps. 10 min to pantheon and Giolitti. I can't comment on the main hotel except for the rooftop bar. The rooftop bar was really nice. Great view of some big bassilica nearby. Drinks were nice. I had read on one review that a person had recommended dinner at the rooftop of Valentino's hotel because the rooftop had great views. Well we went up there to valentino's for a drink one afternoon and that view ---- compared to the view on top of the mozart. BEWARE IN ROME : Not much in terms of late night dining. They could do with a few Denny's in that city for folks leaving the bar. No wonder why they are all so skinny!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: chez3A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double room at Hotel Mozart for three nights in July 2005. We found the room to be absolutely lovely. The room we were allocated had an internal view but was a lovely quiet room. The breakfast was really good with plenty of varied foods and the cakes were delicious! The air-conditioning was much needed (as you can appreciate with Rome's July weather!). You could set the temperature of the room to suit yourselves. We spent the end of every evening sat on the Hotel's roof terrace sharing a bottle of wine - a perfect end to the day. The hotel was perfectly situated to explore all that Rome has to offer. We walked everywhere - to the Vatican and Chapel, Colosseum, Forum, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Everything was in walking distance. We found some lovely restaurants in the nearby vicinity and many restaurants near the major attractions have lunchtime special deals which are very good value. We would certainly return to stay at Hotel Mozart and hopefully our next trip there will be sooner rather than later. We hope perhaps to one day return and take our two daughters to sample the delights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - stay at Vivaldi if you can”
Reviews.Author: V-ronSF
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Spanish steps and on Via del Corso. Vivaldi rooms were large (American hotel size) and quiet. Great roof deck for pre-dinner cocktails, etc. Only downside is you had to have breakfast in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Picu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mozart from three nights in late June with our two teenage children. The hotel has all the amenities, including free Internet access in the lobby/breakfast area. The rooms are very clean and comfortable for two people (we had two rooms). The staff was attentive and responsive to guest needs. The breakfast buffet is ample and quite varied in its assortment of cereal, cheese, ham, breads, fruit, and pastries. The location of the hotel is great...a short walk in one direction to the Metro/Piazzo Popolo and in another, to the Spanish steps, the Trevi Fountain, and the Pantheon. I would stay at this hotel again as I found it a great value given the high price of hotels in Rome. We toured Rome using the company Roman Promenades, which specializes in walking tours. Again, a great value for the price. The groups are small and the staff is highly qualified and very entertaining. If you want to see Rome on foot and not through a tour bus, this tour company will fit your needs. They also have privileged entrances to all the sites, so you avoid the long lines, particularly during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kyf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of May and loved it. If you can afford it, upgrade to suite with balcony. Breakfast was better than anywhere else in Europe I have been. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The location cannot be beat as the Spanish steps are 2 blocks away along with the best shopping in Old Rome. If you want a place with a great location for walking to any of the sites-don't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Vavaldi Suites were outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Jensejo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Vavaldi Suites for four nights (June 22-26). I loved the hotel. The suites are not actually located at the Hotel Mozart, but around the corner. They lie on the second floor of an apartment building. You enter from the main street through a security door to the building, then put in a security code on the second floor to enter the hallway, and finally a key to your room. The added measures to get to the room made us feel extremely safe. In addition, the room faced the inside of the courtyard which made in extremely quite even though it was situated on one of the main streets of rome. The room itself was great. King bed, shower, separate jetted bath, plasma tv and computer in my room to access the internet (for free). Like most European beds, the King is actually two twins pushed together. Some may see this as a negative but I do not. You can use all the facilities of the Hotel Mozart, except the breakfast. Breakfast is actually delivered straight to your room. While I didn't mind it, my wife preferred the breakfast buffet at the Hotel due to eating habits and the ability to choose what she wanted. If I were to mention a negative, it may be that. Georgio was fantastic in his restaurant suggestions. There are some great restaurants and some very bad restaurants in Rome. He sent us to reasonably priced resturants that were fantastic. I LOVE food so it was very important to me that our selection process be perfrect. One restaurant in particular that he suggested was the roof garden at Valetine's. It made our day. In fact the nightly ritual of getting our restaurant made each evening that much better. The location is perfect. We walked to all the major sites, including the forum. If you are going to stay in Rome, I highly recommend that you consider staying here. Best of luck to you.

Reviews.Title: “loved the mozart”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mozart for 3 days on our recent trip to Europe and can honestly say that it was the best hotel on our trip.The service was great and Georgio recommedations were outstanding. We would definitely stay there again and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Mozart hitting all the right notes”
Reviews.Author: Leoandjack
Reviews.Content: Looking for somewhere central as a birthday treat for 75 year old Mum with limited mobility. Choose Mozart after reading the very good reviews it had received. The hotel was excellent, with friendly staff and large well furnished and tidy rooms. The views from the balcony on top are wonderful and the hotel is ideally situated for all sorts of attractions. I wouldn't think of stopping anyhere else upon my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When researching hotels in Rome, you will be overwelmed with choices and locations. And of course, everyone's opinion differs. I highly recommend The Vivaldi Rooms to anyone like me who had never been to Rome and didn't know what area to stay in. I got this hotel recommended by a local businessman, and am very glad I listened to his advice. There was no noise at night. We walked blocks to the Spanish Steps. The area surrounding us was full of shops and places to eat. And we felt safe. The hotel service was friendly and spoke English. They called our Taxis for us when needed and walked outside to talk directly with the driver, to assure that we got to the right destination... (our Italian is limited to "Ciao!".) Breakfast brought to our rooms each morning was plentiful....but, it was the same menu each day...some variety would be nicer. We never made it to the turkish bath, but was impressed to have it at our disposal. Our group had 3 rooms at The Vivaldi Rooms in April 2005 and we stayed for 4 nights. 2 of the rooms were larger, with couches. All were very clean, comfortable and roomy. The bathrooms were wonderful...with jetted tubs and showers, towel warmers, blow dryers, bidets and all were very roomy. Our rooms also had a laptop computer for our use, and a plasma TV. Also, we had our own air conditioner/heater controls. There wasn't one aspect of of our stay that was disappointing, which made our Rome experience a pleasure! For the money, this was worth every Euro!!

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Rooms at Hotel Mozart live up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay at the Hotel Mozart because it was used by a well known British activity holiday company as a Rome base. We then cross checked the details against the Tripadvisor site just to be sure. Our choice of the Vivaldi Prestige Suite lived up to all our expectations and the reviews of previous correspondents. The position is fantastic if you are active and don't mind walking. We hardly used any public transport and got everywhere within 15 to 20 minutes. There might be one or two less than perfect qualities about the accommodation e.g. the room has little natural light but all in all it was a haven of peace and quiet once you left the busy Via del Corso. The finish of the room is all quality and the hotel is excellently run. There is plenty of space in the prestige Vivaldi room. The cost is not perhaps budget basement but it is excellent value for money. Frankly I would not look elsewhere if you wish to stay near the Spanish Steps, the pedestrianised Via del Corso and the fashionable Piazza del Popolo.

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: Abedago
Reviews.Content: I can only concur with the other posts about this wonderful hotel. We stayed in the Vivaldi Suites and it was: immaculate, large enough, very comfortable, and perfectly located for sightseeing. It had: a laptop in the room( free use), telephone, plasma TV ( large), refrigerator with snacks and drinks ( I thought the price of the food was more fair than in most hotels), desk, table and chairs, a bench at the foot of the bed, as well as a stand for the suitcase and a closet with a safe. The bathroom had a shower (with all sorts of jets), jacuzzi tub that had a seat ( I sat there and used the massage part of the shower head to comfort my aching feet!), heated towel rack, terry cloth robes, slippers , hair dryer and great hair products. It also had a great security system. We spent a week there and I never tired of the breakfasts. What is there to say about a large tray that arrives exactly when you ask for it that has all of the following: fresh fruit, 2 containers of yogurt ( one low-fat), crusty rolls, croissant, sweet roll, packaged toast, plate with sliced ham, cheese and hard boiled egg, some sort of orange cake, orange juice, coffee with steamed milk, butter, jams, nutella, and chocolate chip cookies?? And, mind you at no extra cost... not even a room service charge?? In fact, we've been home a week and I still keep hoping someone will knock on the door and bring that tray in! One Tip: Buy your tickets to the Colosseum at the Palatine Hill box office.... then you just walk across the street right into the Colosseum past the lines of hundreds waiting to buy tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Suites......We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much debate, we decided to upgrade to the Vivaldi Suites, specifically a Prestige Room, and it could not have been a better decision. We have traveled all over Europe and found these suites to be the most memorable. Our suite was very quiet and peaceful during our stay, although the maids were loud a little in the morning. We had a very spacious (by European standards) and nicely decorated room with a plasma screen on the wall. Breakfast was delivered to us in bed (literally) within five minutes after we called for it. This was especially remarkable because we are not early risers and still had no problems from the staff with this request at 10:30 AM. Front desk is very knowledgeable about the immediate area and we found their suggestions to be mostly accurate. As you obviously know, the suites are situated off Via del Corso, which is the perfect location for Rome. Close to shopping and the Spanish Steps area, while all the other main attractions are within reasonable walking distance. If you are looking for a unique experience in Rome with great amenities look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mozart”
Reviews.Author: SugarCreek
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Italy. While in Rome we stayed three nights in a triple deluxe suite at the Hotel Mozart. We enjoyed our stay very much. The location is great, between the Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps. We walked everywhere, except the Colosseum. Our suite had a king bed and a single bed for my teenage son. There was a plasma screen TV and a large bathroom and closet. My husband and I enjoyed sitting on our balcony (complete with lemon trees!) at various times of the day, especially in the evening with wine. There was a lot of variety at breakfast. There are countless wonderful restaurants in all price ranges nearby and despite arriving the day after the Pope died, we had no problems just walking in with out reservations. I would definitely recommend the Mozart.

Reviews.Title: “Clean (small) hotel, friendly staff, nice environment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart, tucked away in one of the small side streets of Via Del Corso, was the hotel we stayed in to celebrate our 11th wedding anniversary. It was also our very first visit to Rome and I must admit we made a good choice (thanks to TripAdvisor !) Our small but nice room overlooked the famous Via del Corso (the "Avenue Louise" (Brussels) of Rome) is THE big shopping street of Rome, and leads from Plazza di Popolo towards Plazza Venetia. There are plenty of pizza restaurants and nice little bars where you can have the best per-slice pizza and ice cream you can find. The hotel seems to be renovated recently, and is (very) well maintained. It is clean, very nicely decorated, and is spacious although small. The entrance is tucked away a bit, but once you enter you forget the less flashy entrance. It's very close to the Spanish stairs and Plaza di Popolo, must see's. We asked for a big bed (hey, wedding anniversary, remember ;-) ) and we got it, BUT we got the smallest room of the hotel (as became clear when looking at the fire-escape plan). If you can choose, DON'T get room 312 The breakfast buffet was very nice (good coffee), the choice big enough for us Europeans. The salon with open fireplace was very cosy, and nothing beats reading a (provided by the hotel for free) a newspaper next to the fire, with a glass of red wine after a long day of walking around in Rome. Must do's: - DO find one of those little "enoteca's", where you can enjoy a (pay per glass) glass of wine on a little terrace. - DO try the local's bars and grap the excellent expresso or cappucino - DO go to the local's pizza bars for per-slice and really excellent pizza - DO take a city guide book (strongly advise the Michelin "green book") - DO visit the Castel dell Angelo - DO visit Citta alta (free !) - DO visit the Colloseum Tourist traps: We didn't really encounter any real tourist traps, but mind you for these: - DO realize that you need to buy your subway tickets in the paperstand shops and not inside the subway station (it can be a long way back ;-) ) - DON'T take the subway too much - Rome isn't that big. WALK - Be carefull when asking for non-sparkling water. It's the habit to give you "robinetta", tapwater and charge you for it. Note: it's listed on the price list.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury accommodation in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: kevinm52
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night break staying in a prestige room in the Vivaldi accommodation, Hotel Mozart, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We booked the room as a result of the favourable reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. Our room was spacious, with an extremely comfortable large bed (with excellent pillows) and above all was quiet. It was one of the rooms facing inwards onto a courtyard. We found the use of a Turkish bath (complimentary to those staying in the Vivaldi suites and bookable via reception) to be a relaxing end to a day of sightseeing, along with the jacuzzi bath in our room. The location of the hotel was ideal for seeing all the main sights, although anyone wishing to visit the Vatican museums would be advised to get there early. On our visit to this area we planned to see the museum after our visit to St Peter's and were amazed to see the length of the queue by mid-morning. We decided to return first thing the next day, arriving at 8.15am when there was already a sizeable queue, but nothing like the one the day before. We found travel to and from Ciampino airport very cheap and easy by catching the Cotral bus to the end metro station on line A (Anagnina) and then the metro to Spagna (1 euro each for the coach and 1 euro each for the metro - excellent value). Taxi from the hotel to Ciampino is 48 euros! We would recommend the Vivaldi rooms to anyone looking for comfortable, clean, stylish and relaxing accommodation in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mozart, very nice if you can afford the price !!!”
Reviews.Author: Stefano007
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mozart is Located 10 minutes walk from Spanish steps and Metro station it is situated on Via de Corsa and is quite central. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many of the main attractions Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and not to far to Piazza Navona where some good pubs, cafes and nightlife can be found in the little side street just off the Piazza. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very corteous and helpful. We opted for the Vivaldi luxury rooms which are situated about two minutes walk along the main street from the main Hotel building. The rooms at 200 Euro a night not cheap but are very nice all the same if a little on the small side (apparently this is common in Rome) Continental style breakfast is served in the room every morning on a tray with croisants, bread, preserves, cheese, ham, fruit and yogurt etc. There is a Plasma satellite TV in the room which we never used! too busy sight seeing. Laptop PC in room is included with free internet access, Jacuzzi bath tub. Mini bar and Safe are also included in the room. We used the cocktail bar in main hotel a couple of times for a quick aperitivo!! before sampling the Roma nightlife! the cocktail bar was pleasant enough, on the Hotel roof there is a terrace garden for a drink alfresco for when the weather is nice. Many thanks to Francesco on the hotel front desk, he went out of his way to give us information and to book us restaurant reservations etc. I can highley recommend Valentino's restaurant which is 5 min's walk from the Mozart towards Piazza de Popolo, it is a stylish restaurant, the food was first class and also the service. a nice touch was the "Grand Piano" very Romantic for that special occasion. There is also a nice Piano bar downstairs to Valentinos with live music and dancing.... but watch out for the drinks prices! first drink 15 Euro! and then 10 Euro a drink after that. I said to the waiter "do I look like Onasis" the waiter said this was a cover charge for the entertainment. I said to the waiter "is 'Pavaroti' performing tonight" he just give me a nonchalant glance. To sum up the Mozart is a good quality Hotel and if I return to Rome I would stay at the Mozart again. Ciao!! and have a happy Roman holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “The best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: andrew_branham
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travel the world and have stayed in almost every kind of hotel available. Let me say the the Vittoria Suite at the Hotel Mozart was excellent! The staff was very friendly and went our of their way for us from day one. The suite itself is a bit dated and dark but it nice overall. The suite is literally steps from the best shopping and the Spanish Steps. Via Vittoria has several great places to eat. I will recommend this to anyone. Only bad part of the hotel was that there is no phone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hote....Great tour guide”
Reviews.Author: cba50
Reviews.Content: Like other, I had researched Rome hotels. The Vivaldi Suites are just what other reviewers indicated: quiet, clean, jacuzzi, plasma TV, breakfast served in room and well located. But, one suggestion: rather than take the traditional tours suggested by the front desk from Vastours, use the guide they e-mailed me about: Ms. Marina was excellent and tailored our tours to suit our party of 4. Her costs were competitive with the big companies, but it was nice to be 4 in a Mercedes mini-van with a guide who personalized the experience. Marina used drama to make the tours interesting. she even stood in the Vatican line and had us to arrive later so we didn't have to wait. We have visited Europe and Rome several times and this was by far the best visit, because of the personal touches of Marina. We took a Vastour recommended by Hotel Mozart one night and it was awful....not to say almost $200 for the 4 of us for 2 hours. When the guide was not talking with the driver, she seemed to be reading from a script, only she left off several important details, like the entire Trevi Fountain. She couldn't tell us when it had been erected or for what purpose. We calculated that in realiy the tour really last about 45 minutes when you factor in pick up, pay, load bus, delay the start of tour, circle the same monument 3 times, spend 5 minutes walking to Trevi fountain, 15 minutes there with no details given, 5 minutes back to bus. At end of tour, guide spoke up and said this is stop for Hotel Mozart and we got off and had to walk over 3/4 mile back to hotel. In contrast, Ms. Marina, arranged for our pick up at Vivaldi door and return to same. She is knowledgeable, personable, doesn't spout irrelevant details, bit adds a dramatic flair to each of her tours. She is very adept at manuvering the crowds at St. Peter's and Sistine Chapel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have found a better location or a greater place to stay in the suites. Incredible experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Monmag
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the vivaldi suite on via del corso, just a short walk from the hotel for three nights Feb 2005. A busy street, plenty of shops, close to a taxi rank if you don't fancy walking. Once inside, peace and quiet, beautiful room with tea & coffee making facilities, plasma tv, laptop with free internet use, telephone, thermostat control for heating, breakfast served to your room within 15minutes of ordering it. Bathroom with jacuzzi, shower, hairdryer, bathrobes and slippers. Staff very friendly and helpful, carried our bags to and from the rooms, gave us suggestions on places to eat, booked our taxi to and from the airport. The location is great, close to Spanish steps and within walking distance of all the sights. If you don't feel like walking, taxis rank close by which will take you to the Vatican for around 7 euro. I would highly recommend the Vivaldi suites and would definitely return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfortable, and lovely Vivaldi Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews on tripadvisor and decided to book the luxury suites. It was an awesome 3 nights stay!!! Couldn't ask for a bigger room because the rooms were spacious, a lot better than your European hotels. Rooms were elegantly decorated, very clean, and all the comforts of home. One drawback was that there was not too much variety for the breakfasts that we were served in our rooms. They could have varied the items a bit for guests who were there for more than a few days. Great place to stay in Roma, central to all sights.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days at the hotel Mozart for a New Year's holiday. We are pleased we took the advice of previous comments on the site and upgraded to the Vivaldi Suites as they are definitely worth the extra money. (We spoke to another family who were staying in the main hotel who seemed a little disappointed with their room in the main hotel.) The suite was situated in an annex to the hotel which was very peaceful. The entrance was fitted with cctv and security code entry pad. The room and bathroom was finished to a high standard and was very spacious for 2 adults and 1 child. The use of a new lap top connected to the internet and the fluffy towelling robes and slippers were a welcome surprise. The breakfast was delivered promptly to our room every day at a pre-arranged time and was beautifully presented. The suites are situated off the Via del Corso which was very busy with shoppers but as soon as you closed the large wooden doors behind you felt you were in a peaceful secure haven away from it all. It was perfectly positioned to visit all the main attractions, excellent restaurants and wine bars. L'Enotecantina only 2 streets away in the the Via della Croce is a very popular wine bar which serves pasta etc with a good atmosphere. On New Year's Eve the hotel management invited all the guests to the Jupiter bar in the hotel for free champagne and Panetone cake while watching the magical firework displays across the city from the rooftop garden. We are hoping to go back to Rome and we would definitely stay here again which is probably the best recommendation we can give the hotel! (Good tips while in Rome: Don't wear high heeled shoes as they are ruined by the large gaps in the pavements. Use a student guide to jump the queues at the Colosseum well worth the money and it also includes an excellent tour of the forum. Brits remember to carry photo ID such as passport. We needed this twice to obtain an audio guide at St Peters and to secure students free entry into the Colosseum!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wicklowc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in December. Lovely comfort & atmosphere at The Mozart, with a very friendly service in the bar & at the desk at all times. This location is perfectly suited for shopping and near Spanish Steps. Was lovely to return to a roaring fire in the comfortable 1st floor lounge after a long day walking the streets of Rome. The 'always on' Internet PC was also a very useful service. Will look forward to returning to an excellent quality hotel in an area that is typically expensive for Hotels - this one offers very good value. Thank you to all at The Hotel Mozart for a most enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WHartford
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Hotel Mozart (Nov. 18th through the 21st) - mostly based on the recommendations of others on this sight. We were almost universally pleased with the hotel, which is in a fabulous location. The staff helped us with reservations and information throughout the trip, as well as before we arrived (via email); the breakfast was more than adequate, though there always appeared to be "reserved" signs on the nicest tables by the window; the car service they arranged to the airport was fine and well worth the price (48 euro); and the room was clean. On the down side, we requested a certain room - or at least to be on the 5th floor - when we made the reservation over 4 months ago. We paid the deluxe room price (with a 10% discount for making the reservation in advance) but when we arrived were told nothing on the 5th floor was available. Hmmm...maybe this was because we were getting a discounted rate? The 4th floor room we stayed in was ok - very plain decor, drawers that fell out when pulled, wall fixtures that were loose...but spacious and clean. We were surprised that soap and shampoo was not replenished during our visit without having to ask though, and that a nice hotel was using coat hangers with the security loops on them so that you could not remove the entire hanger! Front desk was helpful but they only had one staff person there so when it was busy, they really could not attend to everyone properly. And because we came off season, the roof bar was closed so they served drinks in the breakfast room which was not very atmospheric - bright lights and cartoon channel on the tv! Over all, we were pleased with the hotel felt it was a good value and in a great location, and would return, but we did have the few concerns raised above.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mozart Roma is a Plus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four nights in the Mozart and found it delightful. We opted for a superior room and were assigned number 504 which is splendid. A friend had a late reservation and was in number 116 which she found uncomfortably small and noisy. The terrace bar just off the fifth floor is a charming spot wfor a cocktail. The staff of the hotel is most accommodating and helpful. The reception made numerous reservations and cheerfully answered many inquiries for us. The included breakfast is certainly all one could wish for in a three star hotel. The location is ideal and within alking access to the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Luxury Rooms: PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite in the Vivaldi Luxury Rooms, everything in the room was fantastic. Well decorated and proportioned bathroom. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The room itself was spacious, with a King bed, lounge sofa, desk and a small table for breakfast. A plasma screen was on the wall. The breakfast is served in the room each day within 15 minutes and was always on-time and fantastic. We even ordered breakfast at 12 noon the day after we arrived!!! How is that for service. There is also a roof terrace bar which is perfect for having a beer at the end of the day and watching the sun go down. Hotel location is also perfect, very close to the Spanish steps. There is nothing I can fault about this hotel and would definitely stay again.....

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Suites - best in Italy”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPro
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 16 day trip to Italy with (3) days in the Vivaldi Suites. As others have stated, these accomodations are simply the best you'll find in Rome for the price paid. Truly 5 star quality for a 3-4 star price. A private enclave of extremely well appointed rooms within walking distance to most attractions. Only suggestion would be to avoid the Ristorante EDY that the friendly front desk recommends. We asked for a good local trattoria that wasn't touristy. . . we ended up dining with the other guests of Hotel Mozart as this appears to be an extension of the hotel. The night we were there, the front desk clerk sat down for dinner at the table next to us and was obviously a frequent diner there. Much better local restaraunt (without many tourists) is Osteria St. Ana at 68 via del Penna near Piazza del Popolo. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned form a long weekend in the Hotel Mozart and would recommend it to anyone. In Rome to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary, so we splashed the cash and stayed in the Vivaldi suites. Expensive, (even with a discount) - but worth every penny. From the Jacuzzi bath to the steam room (practically right outside our door) every aspect of the hotel made you feel special - especially being out of the main hotel in our own private enclave. We overlooked the Via Corsa, so we people watched as we ate breakfast (served in bed - on a silver salver) and slept with the blinds closed and the windows open so we could still hear the sounds of the city. Could rave on about this - but I'd rather you tried it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Vivaldi Residence, absolutely great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned yesterday from this lovely hotel. We stayed in room 610 at the Vivaldi Residence, and it was really much better then I expected, I am usually in 4 or 5 star hotels, but since I had read so many positive reviews I decided to give it a try. our room was very spacious, with plasma screen and a marble spacious bathroom, with separate shower and separate jacuzzi, which was great... the sink was big, there was a bidet, lots of little beauy products from the hotel and plenty of towels. The breakfast was served every morning in our room by a very friendly girl and the breakfast included croissants, rolls, cake, cookie, marmelade, juice, yoghurt so even though you don-t get the buffet breakfast at the vivaldi residence, breakfast is just perfect. we had a very good airco, which kept our room very cool (needless to say it was extremely hot in Rome, 34 degrees.....) The staff was very friendly and very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Vittoria Suite”
Reviews.Author: Chappaqua3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vittoria Suite which is a one bedroom apartment operated by the Mozart. A true find in Rome! It is a renovated 1 BR apt in a neat building on Via Vittoria, a beautiful cobblestoned street lined with exclusive boutiques. The apartment was a little dark but had every ammenity including a full kitchen (there is a supermarcato down the street), 2 flat screen TVs with DVD players, a cell phone, a computer with DSL hook-up and incredible air-conditioning which is a big plus in Rome during the summer. My family of three stayed there for 176 euros a night which included free airport transfers and a very nice buffet breakfast at the Mozart. The rooftop garden of the Mozart is beuatiful and a great place to have evening drinks. The lobby of the hotel itself is a little run down, but the rooms in the new wing were large and nicely decorated. The best part of the Vittoria Suite was it made you feel as if you were living in Rome, not that you were a tourist. A great find!

Reviews.Title: “We will be going back there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Mozarts Rezadenza Vivaldi and it was amazing. We stayed in rooms 618 & 620 and there was 7 of us all together. The rooms were very elegant, clean, big and had climate control, plasma screen TV, and very comfortable huge beds. The bathrooms were very elegant and modern with slate black tiles with white and crome. There is also radio that is great in the bathrooms, and massaging jets in the bath, as well as an excellent shower. The staff were very curteous and Antonio was very helpfull indeed. They would do anything to help. The Motzart Hotel itself has an amazing roof terrace, which is very tranquil. You get a free cocktail on arrival too. The breakfast was served to your room and it was silver service. This was very handy. The ladies who serve it are very curteous as well. We were 5 mins walk from the Spanish Steps and facing the Via del Corso. We are going back again this year and staying there again as we were so impressed. We usually stay at Gleneagles Hotel, and although Vivaldi was not that standard it was a very good attempt. We would only stay there on any return trips to Rome as it is also just like having your own privacy of an apartment. Excellent all round.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mozart
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Greci, 23/B, 00187 Rome, Italy
